    # contact_groups - (Required) List contact groups of the alarm rule, which must have been created on the console.
    contact_groups = ""

    # threshold - (Required) Alarm threshold value, which must be a numeric value currently.
    threshold = ""

    # name - (Required) The alarm rule name.
    name = ""

    # project - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) Monitor project name, such as "acs_ecs_dashboard" and "acs_rds_dashboard". For more information, see [Metrics Reference](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/28619.htm).
    project = ""

    # metric - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) Name of the monitoring metrics corresponding to a project, such as "CPUUtilization" and "networkin_rate". For more information, see [Metrics Reference](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/28619.htm).
    metric = ""

    # dimensions - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) Map of the resources associated with the alarm rule, such as "instanceId", "device" and "port". Each key's value is a string and it uses comma to split multiple items. For more information, see [Metrics Reference](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/28619.htm).
    dimensions = ""

    # period - (Optional) Index query cycle, which must be consistent with that defined for metrics. Default to 300, in seconds.
    period = ""

    # statistics - (Optional) Statistical method. It must be consistent with that defined for metrics. Valid values: ["Average", "Minimum", "Maximum"]. Default to "Average".
    statistics = ""

    # operator - (Optional) Alarm comparison operator. Valid values: ["<=", "<", ">", ">=", "==", "!="]. Default to "==".
    operator = ""

    # triggered_count - (Optional) Number of consecutive times it has been detected that the values exceed the threshold. Default to 3.
    triggered_count = ""

    # start_time - (Optional) Start time of the alarm effective period. Default to 0 and it indicates the time 00:00. Valid value range: [0, 24].
    start_time = ""

    # end_time - (Optional) End time of the alarm effective period. Default value 24 and it indicates the time 24:00. Valid value range: [0, 24].
    end_time = ""

    # silence_time - (Optional) Notification silence period in the alarm state, in seconds. Valid value range: [300, 86400]. Default to 86400
    silence_time = ""

    # notify_type - (Optional) Notification type. Valid value [0, 1]. The value 0 indicates TradeManager+email, and the value 1 indicates that TradeManager+email+SMS
    notify_type = ""

    # enabled - (Optional) Whether to enable alarm rule. Default to true.
    enabled = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the alarm rule.
    # "name" - The alarm name.
    # "project" - Monitor project name.
    # "metric" - Name of the monitoring metrics.
    # "dimensions" - Map of the resources associated with the alarm rule.
    # "period" - Index query cycle.
    # "statistics" - Statistical method.
    # "operator" - Alarm comparison operator.
    # "threshold" - Alarm threshold value.
    # "triggered_count" - Number of trigger alarm.
    # "contact_groups" - List contact groups of the alarm rule.
    # "start_time" - Start time of the alarm effective period.
    # "end_time" - End time of the alarm effective period.
    # "silence_time" - Notification silence period in the alarm state.
    # "notify_type" - Notification type.
    # "enabled" - Whether to enable alarm rule.
    # "status" - The current alarm rule status.
}
alicloud-resource-cms-alarm.description:
This resource provides a alarm rule resource and it can be used to monitor several cloud services according different metrics.
Details for [alarm rule](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/28608.htm).

alicloud-resource-common-bandwidth-packa.body:
resource "alicloud_common_bandwidth_package" "$1" {
    # bandwidth - (Required) The bandwidth of the common bandwidth package, in Mbps.
    bandwidth = ""

    # internet_charge_type - (Optional) (Optional, ForceNew) The billing method of the common bandwidth package. Valid values are "PayByBandwidth" and "PayBy95" and "PayByTraffic". "PayBy95" is pay by classic 95th percentile pricing. International Account doesn't supports "PayByBandwidth" and "PayBy95". Default to "PayByTraffic".
    internet_charge_type = ""

    # ratio - (Optional) Ratio of the common bandwidth package. It is valid when `internet_charge_type` is `PayBy95`. Default to 100. Valid values: [10-100].
    ratio = ""

    # name - (Optional) The name of the common bandwidth package.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) The description of the common bandwidth package instance.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the common bandwidth package instance id.
}
alicloud-resource-common-bandwidth-packa.description: Provides a common bandwidth package resource. ~> **NOTE:** Terraform will auto build common bandwidth package instance while it uses `alicloud_common_bandwidth_package` to build a common bandwidth package resource. For information about common bandwidth package and how to use it, see [What is Common Bandwidth Package](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/product/55092.htm). For information about common bandwidth package billing methods, see [Common Bandwidth Package Billing Methods](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/67459.html?spm=a2c5t.11065259.1996646101.searchclickresult.7ec93235Vfkwhy).

alicloud-resource-common-bandwidth-packa.body:
resource "alicloud_common_bandwidth_package_attachment" "$1" {
    # bandwidth_package_id - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The bandwidth_package_id of the common bandwidth package attachment, the field can't be changed.
    bandwidth_package_id = ""

    # instance_id - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The instance_id of the common bandwidth package attachment, the field can't be changed.
    instance_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the common bandwidth package attachment id and formates as "<bandwidth_package_id>:<instance_id>".
}
alicloud-resource-common-bandwidth-packa.description: Provides an Alicloud Common Bandwidth Package Attachment resource for associating Common Bandwidth Package to EIP Instance. ~> **NOTE:** Terraform will auto build common bandwidth package attachment while it uses `alicloud_common_bandwidth_package_attachment` to build a common bandwidth package attachment resource. For information about common bandwidth package and how to use it, see [What is Common Bandwidth Package](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/product/55092.htm).

alicloud-resource-container-cluster.description:
~> **NOTE:** This resource name has been replaced by [`alicloud_cs_swarm`](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/alicloud/r/cs_swarm.html) from [version 1.8.2](https://releases.hashicorp.com/terraform-provider-alicloud/1.8.2/).
Please update it.

alicloud-resource-cs-application.body:
resource "alicloud_cs_application" "$1" {
    # cluster_name - (Optional) (Required, Force new resource) The swarm cluster's name.
    cluster_name = ""

    # name - (Optional) (Required, Force new resource) The application name. It should be 1-64 characters long, and can contain numbers, English letters and hyphens, but cannot start with hyphens.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) The description of application.
    description = ""

    # version - (Optional) The application deploying version. Each updating, it must be different with current. Default to "1.0"
    version = ""

    # template - (Optional) The application deployment template and it must be [Docker Compose format](https://docs.docker.com/compose/).
    template = ""

    # environment - (Optional) A key/value map used to replace the variable parameter in the Compose template.
    environment = ""

    # latest_image - (Optional) Whether to use latest docker image while each updating application. Default to false.
    latest_image = ""

    # blue_green - (Optional) Wherther to use "Blue Green" method when release a new version. Default to false.
    blue_green = ""

    # blue_green_confirm - (Optional) Whether to confirm a "Blue Green" application. Default to false. It will be ignored when `blue_green` is false.
    blue_green_confirm = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the container application. It's formate is "<cluster_name>:<name>".
    # "cluster_name" - The name of the container cluster.
    # "name" - The application name.
    # "description" - The application description.
    # "template" - The application deploying template.
    # "environment" - The application environment variables.
    # "services" - List of services in the application. It contains several attributes to "Block Nodes".
    # "default_domain" - The application default domain and it can be used to configure routing service.
}
alicloud-resource-cs-application.description:
This resource use an orchestration template to define and deploy a multi-container application. An application is created by using an orchestration template.
Each application can contain one or more services. -> **NOTE:** Application orchestration template must be a valid Docker Compose YAML template. -> **NOTE:** At present, this resource only support swarm cluster.

alicloud-resource-cs-kubernetes.body:
resource "alicloud_cs_kubernetes" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) The kubernetes cluster's name. It is the only in one Alicloud account.
    name = ""

    # name_prefix - (Optional) The kubernetes cluster name's prefix. It is conflict with `name`. If it is specified, terraform will using it to build the only cluster name. Default to "Terraform-Creation".
    name_prefix = ""

    # availability_zone - (Optional) (Force new resource) The Zone where new kubernetes cluster will be located. If it is not be specified, the value will be vswitch's zone.
    availability_zone = ""

    # vswitch_id - (Optional) (Deprecated from version 1.16.0)(Force new resource) The vswitch where new kubernetes cluster will be located. If it is not specified, a new VPC and VSwicth will be built. It must be in the zone which `availability_zone` specified.
    vswitch_id = ""

    # vswitch_ids - (Optional) (Force new resource) The vswitch where new kubernetes cluster will be located. For SingleAZ Cluster, if it is not specified, a new VPC and VSwicth will be built. It must be in the zone which `availability_zone` specified. For MultiAZ Cluster, you must create three vswitches firstly, specify them here.
    vswitch_ids = ""

    # new_nat_gateway - (Optional) (Force new resource) Whether to create a new nat gateway while creating kubernetes cluster. Default to true.
    new_nat_gateway = ""

    # master_instance_type - (Optional) (Deprecated from version 1.16.0)(Required, Force new resource) The instance type of master node.
    master_instance_type = ""

    # master_instance_types - (Optional) (Required, Force new resource) The instance type of master node. Specify one type for single AZ Cluster, three types for MultiAZ Cluster.
    master_instance_types = ""

    # worker_instance_type - (Optional) (Deprecated from version 1.16.0)(Required, Force new resource) The instance type of worker node.
    worker_instance_type = ""

    # worker_instance_types - (Optional) (Required, Force new resource) The instance type of worker node. Specify one type for single AZ Cluster, three types for MultiAZ Cluster.
    worker_instance_types = ""

    # worker_number - (Optional) The worker node number of the kubernetes cluster. Default to 3. It is limited up to 50 and if you want to enlarge it, please apply white list or contact with us.
    worker_number = ""

    # password - (Optional) (Required, Force new resource) The password of ssh login cluster node. You have to specify one of `password` and `key_name` fields.
    password = ""

    # key_name - (Optional) (Required, Force new resource) The keypair of ssh login cluster node, you have to create it first.
    key_name = ""

    # cluster_network_type - (Optional) (Required, Force new resource) The network that cluster uses, use `flannel` or `terway`.
    cluster_network_type = ""

    # pod_cidr - (Optional) (Required, Force new resource) The CIDR block for the pod network. It will be allocated automatically when `vswitch_ids` is not specified.
    pod_cidr = ""

    # service_cidr - (Optional) (Required, Force new resource) The CIDR block for the service network.  It will be allocated automatically when `vswitch_id` is not specified.
    service_cidr = ""

    # master_instance_charge_type - (Optional) (Optional, Force new resource) Master payment type. `PrePaid` or `PostPaid`, defaults to `PostPaid`.
    master_instance_charge_type = ""

    # master_period_unit - (Optional) Master payment period unit. `Month` or `Week`, defaults to `Month`.
    master_period_unit = ""

    # master_period - (Optional) Master payment period. When period unit is `Month`, it can be one of { “1”, “2”, “3”, “4”, “5”, “6”, “7”, “8”, “9”, “12”, “24”, “36”,”48”,”60”}.  When period unit is `Week`, it can be one of {“1”, “2”, “3”, “4”}.
    master_period = ""

    # master_auto_renew - (Optional) Enable master payment auto-renew, defaults to false.
    master_auto_renew = ""

    # master_auto_renew_period - (Optional) Master payment auto-renew period. When period unit is `Month`, it can be one of {“1”, “2”, “3”, “6”, “12”}.  When period unit is `Week`, it can be one of {“1”, “2”, “3”}.
    master_auto_renew_period = ""

    # worker_instance_charge_type - (Optional) (Optional, Force new resource) Worker payment type. `PrePaid` or `PostPaid`, defaults to `PostPaid`.
    worker_instance_charge_type = ""

    # worker_period_unit - (Optional) Worker payment period unit. `Month` or `Week`, defaults to `Month`.
    worker_period_unit = ""

    # worker_period - (Optional) Worker payment period. When period unit is `Month`, it can be one of { “1”, “2”, “3”, “4”, “5”, “6”, “7”, “8”, “9”, “12”, “24”, “36”,”48”,”60”}.  When period unit is `Week`, it can be one of {“1”, “2”, “3”, “4”}.
    worker_period = ""

    # worker_auto_renew - (Optional) Enable worker payment auto-renew, defaults to false.
    worker_auto_renew = ""

    # worker_auto_renew_period - (Optional) Worker payment auto-renew period. When period unit is `Month`, it can be one of {“1”, “2”, “3”, “6”, “12”}.  When period unit is `Week`, it can be one of {“1”, “2”, “3”}.
    worker_auto_renew_period = ""

    # node_cidr_mask - (Optional) (Optional, Force new resource) The network mask used on pods for each node, ranging from `24` to `28`.
    node_cidr_mask = ""

    # log_config - (Optional) (Optional, Force new resource) A list of one element containing information about the associated log store. It contains the following attributes:
    log_config = ""

    # type - (Optional) Type of collecting logs, only `SLS` are supported currently.
    type = ""

    # project - (Optional) Log Service project name, cluster logs will output to this project.
    project = ""

    # enable_ssh - (Optional) (Force new resource) Whether to allow to SSH login kubernetes. Default to false.
    enable_ssh = ""

    # slb_internet_enabled - (Optional) (Force new resource) Whether to create internet load balancer for API Server. Default to true.
    slb_internet_enabled = ""

    # master_disk_category - (Optional) (Force new resource) The system disk category of master node. Its valid value are `cloud_ssd` and `cloud_efficiency`. Default to `cloud_efficiency`.
    master_disk_category = ""

    # master_disk_size - (Optional) (Force new resource) The system disk size of master node. Its valid value range [20~32768] in GB. Default to 20.
    master_disk_size = ""

    # worker_disk_category - (Optional) (Force new resource) The system disk category of worker node. Its valid value are `cloud_ssd` and `cloud_efficiency`. Default to `cloud_efficiency`.
    worker_disk_category = ""

    # worker_disk_size - (Optional) (Force new resource) The system disk size of worker node. Its valid value range [20~32768] in GB. Default to 20.
    worker_disk_size = ""

    # worker_data_disk_size - (Optional) (Force new resource) The data disk size of worker node. Its valid value range [20~32768] in GB. When `worker_data_disk_category` is presented, it defaults to 40.
    worker_data_disk_size = ""

    # worker_data_disk_category - (Optional) (Force new resource) The data disk category of worker node. Its valid value are `cloud_ssd` and `cloud_efficiency`, if not set, data disk will not be created.
    worker_data_disk_category = ""

    # install_cloud_monitor - (Optional) (Force new resource) Whether to install cloud monitor for the kubernetes' node.
    install_cloud_monitor = ""

    # is_outdated - (Optional) Whether to use outdated instance type. Default to false.
    is_outdated = ""

    # kube_config - (Optional) The path of kube config, like `~/.kube/config`.
    kube_config = ""

    # client_cert - (Optional) The path of client certificate, like `~/.kube/client-cert.pem`.
    client_cert = ""

    # client_key - (Optional) The path of client key, like `~/.kube/client-key.pem`.
    client_key = ""

    # cluster_ca_cert - (Optional) The path of cluster ca certificate, like `~/.kube/cluster-ca-cert.pem`
    cluster_ca_cert = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the container cluster.
    # "name" - The name of the container cluster.
    # "availability_zone" - The ID of availability zone.
    # "key_name" - The keypair of ssh login cluster node, you have to create it first.
    # "worker_number" - (Deprecated from version 1.16.0) The ECS instance node number in the current container cluster.
    # "worker_numbers" - The ECS instance node number in the current container cluster.
    # "vswitch_id" - (Deprecated from version 1.16.0) The ID of VSwitch where the current cluster is located.
    # "vswitch_ids" - The ID of VSwitches where the current cluster is located.
    # "vpc_id" - The ID of VPC where the current cluster is located.
    # "slb_id" - (Deprecated from version 1.9.2).
    # "slb_internet_enabled" - Whether internet load balancer for API Server is created
    # "slb_internet" - The ID of public load balancer where the current cluster master node is located.
    # "slb_intranet" - The ID of private load balancer where the current cluster master node is located.
    # "security_group_id" - The ID of security group where the current cluster worker node is located.
    # "image_id" - The ID of node image.
    # "nat_gateway_id" - The ID of nat gateway used to launch kubernetes cluster.
    # "master_instance_type" - (Deprecated from version 1.16.0) The instance type of master node.
    # "master_instance_types" - The instance type of master node.
    # "worker_instance_type" - (Deprecated from version 1.16.0)The instance type of worker node.
    # "worker_instance_types" - The instance type of worker node.
    # "master_disk_category" - The system disk category of master node.
    # "master_disk_size" - The system disk size of master node.
    # "worker_disk_category" - The system disk category of worker node.
    # "worker_disk_size" - The system disk size of worker node.
    # "worker_data_disk_category" - The data disk size of worker node.
    # "worker_data_disk_size" - The data disk category of worker node.
    # "nodes" - (Deprecated from version 1.9.4) It has been deprecated from provider version 1.9.4. New field "master_nodes" and "worker_nodes" replace it.
    # "master_nodes" - List of cluster master nodes. It contains several attributes to "Block Nodes".
    # "worker_nodes" - List of cluster worker nodes. It contains several attributes to "Block Nodes".
    # "connections" - Map of kubernetes cluster connection information. It contains several attributes to "Block Connections".
    # "node_cidr_mask" - The network mask used on pods for each node.
    # "log_config" - A list of one element containing information about the associated log store. It contains the following attributes:
    # "type" - Type of collecting logs.
    # "project" - Log Service project name.
}
alicloud-resource-cs-kubernetes.description:
This resource will help you to manager a Kubernetes Cluster. The cluster is same as container service created by web console. -> **NOTE:** Kubernetes cluster only supports VPC network and it can access internet while creating kubernetes cluster.
A Nat Gateway and configuring a SNAT for it can ensure one VPC network access internet. If there is no nat gateway in the
VPC, you can set `new_nat_gateway` to "true" to create one automatically. -> **NOTE:** If there is no specified `vswitch_ids`, the resource will create a new VPC and VSwitch while creating kubernetes cluster. -> **NOTE:** Each kubernetes cluster contains 3 master nodes and those number cannot be changed at now. -> **NOTE:** Creating kubernetes cluster need to install several packages and it will cost about 15 minutes. Please be patient. -> **NOTE:** From version 1.9.4, the provider supports to download kube config, client certificate, client key and cluster ca certificate
after creating cluster successfully, and you can put them into the specified location, like '~/.kube/config'. -> **NOTE:** From version 1.16.0, the provider supports Multiple Availability Zones Kubernetes Cluster. To create a cluster of this kind,
you must specify three items in `vswitch_ids`, `master_instance_types` and `worker_instance_types`. -> **NOTE:** From version 1.20.0, the provider supports disabling internet load balancer for API Server by setting `false` to `slb_internet_enabled`. -> **NOTE:** If you want to manage Kubernetes, you can use [Kubernetes Provider](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/kubernetes/index.html).

alicloud-resource-cs-managed-kubernetes.body:
resource "alicloud_cs_managed_kubernetes" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) The kubernetes cluster's name. It is the only in one Alicloud account.
    name = ""

    # name_prefix - (Optional) The kubernetes cluster name's prefix. It is conflict with `name`. If it is specified, terraform will using it to build the only cluster name. Default to "Terraform-Creation".
    name_prefix = ""

    # availability_zone - (Optional) (Force new resource) The Zone where new kubernetes cluster will be located. If it is not be specified, the value will be vswitch's zone.
    availability_zone = ""

    # vswitch_ids - (Optional) (Force new resource) The vswitch where new kubernetes cluster will be located. Specify one vswitch's id, if it is not specified, a new VPC and VSwicth will be built. It must be in the zone which `availability_zone` specified.
    vswitch_ids = ""

    # new_nat_gateway - (Optional) (Force new resource) Whether to create a new nat gateway while creating kubernetes cluster. Default to true.
    new_nat_gateway = ""

    # password - (Optional) (Required, Force new resource) The password of ssh login cluster node. You have to specify one of `password` and `key_name` fields.
    password = ""

    # key_name - (Optional) (Required, Force new resource) The keypair of ssh login cluster node, you have to create it first.
    key_name = ""

    # pod_cidr - (Optional) (Required, Force new resource) The CIDR block for the pod network. It will be allocated automatically when `vswitch_ids` is not specified.
    pod_cidr = ""

    # service_cidr - (Optional) (Required, Force new resource) The CIDR block for the service network.  It will be allocated automatically when `vswitch_id` is not specified.
    service_cidr = ""

    # install_cloud_monitor - (Optional) (Force new resource) Whether to install cloud monitor for the kubernetes' node.
    install_cloud_monitor = ""

    # worker_disk_size - (Optional) (Force new resource) The system disk size of worker node. Its valid value range [20~32768] in GB. Default to 20.
    worker_disk_size = ""

    # worker_disk_category - (Optional) (Force new resource) The system disk category of worker node. Its valid value are `cloud_ssd` and `cloud_efficiency`. Default to `cloud_efficiency`.
    worker_disk_category = ""

    # worker_data_disk_size - (Optional) (Force new resource) The data disk size of worker node. Its valid value range [20~32768] in GB. When `worker_data_disk_category` is presented, it defaults to 40.
    worker_data_disk_size = ""

    # worker_data_disk_category - (Optional) (Force new resource) The data disk category of worker node. Its valid value are `cloud_ssd` and `cloud_efficiency`, if not set, data disk will not be created.
    worker_data_disk_category = ""

    # worker_numbers - (Optional) The worker node number of the kubernetes cluster. Default to [3]. It is limited up to 50 and if you want to enlarge it, please apply white list or contact with us.
    worker_numbers = ""

    # worker_instance_types - (Optional) (Required, Force new resource) The instance type of worker node. Specify one type for single AZ Cluster, three types for MultiAZ Cluster.
    worker_instance_types = ""

    # worker_instance_charge_type - (Optional) (Optional, Force new resource) Worker payment type. `PrePaid` or `PostPaid`, defaults to `PostPaid`.
    worker_instance_charge_type = ""

    # worker_period_unit - (Optional) Worker payment period unit. `Month` or `Week`, defaults to `Month`.
    worker_period_unit = ""

    # worker_period - (Optional) Worker payment period. When period unit is `Month`, it can be one of { “1”, “2”, “3”, “4”, “5”, “6”, “7”, “8”, “9”, “12”, “24”, “36”,”48”,”60”}.  When period unit is `Week`, it can be one of {“1”, “2”, “3”, “4”}.
    worker_period = ""

    # worker_auto_renew - (Optional) Enable worker payment auto-renew, defaults to false.
    worker_auto_renew = ""

    # worker_auto_renew_period - (Optional) Worker payment auto-renew period. When period unit is `Month`, it can be one of {“1”, “2”, “3”, “6”, “12”}.  When period unit is `Week`, it can be one of {“1”, “2”, “3”}.
    worker_auto_renew_period = ""

    # cluster_network_type - (Optional) (Optional, Force new resource) The network that cluster uses, use `flannel` or `terway`.
    cluster_network_type = ""

    # kube_config - (Optional) The path of kube config, like `~/.kube/config`.
    kube_config = ""

    # client_cert - (Optional) The path of client certificate, like `~/.kube/client-cert.pem`.
    client_cert = ""

    # client_key - (Optional) The path of client key, like `~/.kube/client-key.pem`.
    client_key = ""

    # cluster_ca_cert - (Optional) The path of cluster ca certificate, like `~/.kube/cluster-ca-cert.pem`
    cluster_ca_cert = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the container cluster.
    # "name" - The name of the container cluster.
    # "availability_zone" - The ID of availability zone.
    # "key_name" - The keypair of ssh login cluster node, you have to create it first.
    # "worker_numbers" - The ECS instance node number in the current container cluster.
    # "vswitch_ids" - The ID of VSwitches where the current cluster is located.
    # "vpc_id" - The ID of VPC where the current cluster is located.
    # "security_group_id" - The ID of security group where the current cluster worker node is located.
    # "image_id" - The ID of node image.
    # "nat_gateway_id" - The ID of nat gateway used to launch kubernetes cluster.
    # "worker_instance_types" - The instance type of worker node.
    # "worker_disk_size" - The system disk size of worker node.
    # "worker_disk_category" - The system disk category of worker node.
    # "worker_data_disk_size" - The data disk category of worker node.
    # "worker_data_disk_category" - The data disk size of worker node.
    # "worker_nodes" - List of cluster worker nodes. It contains several attributes to "Block Nodes".
}
alicloud-resource-cs-managed-kubernetes.description:
This resource will help you to manager a Managed Kubernetes Cluster. The cluster is same as container service created by web console. -> **NOTE:** Managed Kubernetes cluster only supports single availability zone currently. Arguments `vswitch_ids`, `worker_numbers`, `worker_instance_types` only accept one item. -> **NOTE:** Managed Kubernetes cluster only supports VPC network and it can access internet while creating kubernetes cluster.
A Nat Gateway and configuring a SNAT for it can ensure one VPC network access internet. If there is no nat gateway in the
VPC, you can set `new_nat_gateway` to "true" to create one automatically. -> **NOTE:** If there is no specified `vswitch_ids`, the resource will create a new VPC and VSwitch while creating managed kubernetes cluster. -> **NOTE:** Creating managed kubernetes cluster need to install several packages and it will cost about 10 minutes. Please be patient. -> **NOTE:** The provider supports to download kube config, client certificate, client key and cluster ca certificate
after creating cluster successfully, and you can put them into the specified location, like '~/.kube/config'. -> **NOTE:** If you want to manage managed Kubernetes, you can use [Kubernetes Provider](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/kubernetes/index.html).

alicloud-resource-cs-swarm.body:
resource "alicloud_cs_swarm" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) The container cluster's name. It is the only in one Alicloud account.
    name = ""

    # name_prefix - (Optional) The container cluster name's prefix. It is conflict with `name`. If it is specified, terraform will using it to build the only cluster name. Default to 'Terraform-Creation'.
    name_prefix = ""

    # size - (Optional) Field 'size' has been deprecated from provider version 1.9.1. New field 'node_number' replaces it.
    size = ""

    # node_number - (Optional) The ECS node number of the container cluster. Its value choices are 1~50, and default to 1.
    node_number = ""

    # cidr_block - (Optional) (Required, Force new resource) The CIDR block for the Container. It can not be same as the CIDR used by the VPC. Valid value: 192.168.0.0/16
    cidr_block = ""

    # cidr_block - (Optional) (Required, Force new resource) The CIDR block for the Container. It can not be same as the CIDR used by the VPC. Valid value: 192.168.0.0/16
    cidr_block = ""

    # cidr_block - (Optional) (Required, Force new resource) The CIDR block for the Container. It can not be same as the CIDR used by the VPC. Valid value: 192.168.0.0/16
    cidr_block = ""

    # cidr_block - (Optional) (Required, Force new resource) The CIDR block for the Container. It can not be same as the CIDR used by the VPC. Valid value: 192.168.0.0/16
    cidr_block = ""

    # image_id - (Optional) (Force new resource) The image ID of ECS instance node used. Default to System automate allocated.
    image_id = ""

    # instance_type - (Optional) (Required, Force new resource) The type of ECS instance node.
    instance_type = ""

    # image_id - (Optional) (Force new resource) The image ID of ECS instance node used. Default to System automate allocated.
    image_id = ""

    # is_outdated - (Optional) Whether to use outdated instance type. Default to false.
    is_outdated = ""

    # image_id - (Optional) (Force new resource) The image ID of ECS instance node used. Default to System automate allocated.
    image_id = ""

    # password - (Optional) (Required, Force new resource) The password of ECS instance node.
    password = ""

    # image_id - (Optional) (Force new resource) The image ID of ECS instance node used. Default to System automate allocated.
    image_id = ""

    # disk_category - (Optional) (Force new resource) The data disk category of ECS instance node. Its valid value are `cloud_ssd` and `cloud_efficiency`. Default to `cloud_efficiency`.
    disk_category = ""

    # image_id - (Optional) (Force new resource) The image ID of ECS instance node used. Default to System automate allocated.
    image_id = ""

    # disk_size - (Optional) (Force new resource) The data disk size of ECS instance node. Its valid value is 20~32768 GB. Default to 20.
    disk_size = ""

    # image_id - (Optional) (Force new resource) The image ID of ECS instance node used. Default to System automate allocated.
    image_id = ""

    # vswitch_id - (Optional) (Required, Force new resource) The password of ECS instance node. If it is not specified, the container cluster's network mode will be `Classic`.
    vswitch_id = ""

    # image_id - (Optional) (Force new resource) The image ID of ECS instance node used. Default to System automate allocated.
    image_id = ""

    # release_eip - (Optional) Whether to release EIP after creating swarm cluster successfully. Default to false.
    release_eip = ""

    # image_id - (Optional) (Force new resource) The image ID of ECS instance node used. Default to System automate allocated.
    image_id = ""

    # need_slb - (Optional) `need_slb`- Whether to create the default simple routing Server Load Balancer instance for the cluster. The default value is true.
    need_slb = ""

    # image_id - (Optional) (Force new resource) The image ID of ECS instance node used. Default to System automate allocated.
    image_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the container cluster.
    # "image_id" - (Force new resource) The image ID of ECS instance node used. Default to System automate allocated.
    # "name" - The name of the container cluster.
    # "image_id" - (Force new resource) The image ID of ECS instance node used. Default to System automate allocated.
    # "size" - It has been deprecated from provider version 1.9.1. New field 'node_number' replaces it.
    # "image_id" - (Force new resource) The image ID of ECS instance node used. Default to System automate allocated.
    # "node_number" - The node number.
    # "image_id" - (Force new resource) The image ID of ECS instance node used. Default to System automate allocated.
    # "vpc_id" - The ID of VPC where the current cluster is located.
    # "image_id" - (Force new resource) The image ID of ECS instance node used. Default to System automate allocated.
    # "vswitch_id" - The ID of VSwitch where the current cluster is located.
    # "image_id" - (Force new resource) The image ID of ECS instance node used. Default to System automate allocated.
    # "slb_id" - The ID of load balancer where the current cluster worker node is located.
    # "image_id" - (Force new resource) The image ID of ECS instance node used. Default to System automate allocated.
    # "security_group_id" - The ID of security group where the current cluster worker node is located.
    # "image_id" - (Force new resource) The image ID of ECS instance node used. Default to System automate allocated.
    # "agent_version" - The nodes agent version.
    # "image_id" - (Force new resource) The image ID of ECS instance node used. Default to System automate allocated.
    # "instance_type" - The instance type of nodes.
    # "image_id" - (Force new resource) The image ID of ECS instance node used. Default to System automate allocated.
    # "disk_category" - The data disk category of nodes.
    # "image_id" - (Force new resource) The image ID of ECS instance node used. Default to System automate allocated.
    # "disk_size" - The data disk size of nodes.
    # "image_id" - (Force new resource) The image ID of ECS instance node used. Default to System automate allocated.
    # "nodes" - List of cluster nodes. It contains several attributes to "Block Nodes".
    # "image_id" - (Force new resource) The image ID of ECS instance node used. Default to System automate allocated.
}
alicloud-resource-cs-swarm.description: This resource will help you to manager a Swarm Cluster. -> **NOTE:** Swarm cluster only supports VPC network and you can specify a VPC network by filed `vswitch_id`.

alicloud-resource-datahub-project.body:
resource "alicloud_datahub_project" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The name of the datahub project. Its length is limited to 3-32 and only characters such as letters, digits and '_' are allowed. It is case-insensitive.
    name = ""

    # comment - (Optional) Comment of the datahub project. It cannot be longer than 255 characters.
    comment = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the datahub project. It is the same as its name.
    # "create_time" - Create time of the datahub project. It is a human-readable string rather than 64-bits UTC.
    # "last_modify_time" - Last modify time of the datahub project. It is the same as *create_time* at the beginning. It is also a human-readable string rather than 64-bits UTC.
}
alicloud-resource-datahub-project.description: The project is the basic unit of resource management in Datahub Service and is used to isolate and control resources. It contains a set of Topics. You can manage the datahub sources of an application by using projects. [Refer to details](https://help.aliyun.com/document_detail/47440.html). -> **NOTE:** Currently Datahub service only can be supported in the regions: cn-beijing, cn-hangzhou, cn-shanghai, cn-shenzhen,  ap-southeast-1.

alicloud-resource-datahub-subscription.body:
resource "alicloud_datahub_subscription" "$1" {
    # project_name - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The name of the datahub project that the subscription belongs to. Its length is limited to 3-32 and only characters such as letters, digits and '_' are allowed. It is case-insensitive.
    project_name = ""

    # topic_name - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The name of the datahub topic that the subscription belongs to. Its length is limited to 1-128 and only characters such as letters, digits and '_' are allowed. It is case-insensitive.
    topic_name = ""

    # comment - (Optional) Comment of the datahub subscription. It cannot be longer than 255 characters.
    comment = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the datahub subscritpion as terraform resource. It was composed of project name, topic name and practical subscription ID generated from server side. Format to "<project_name>:<topic_name>:<sub_id>".
    # "sub_id" - The identidy of the subscritpion, generate from server side.
    # "create_time" - Create time of the datahub subscription. It is a human-readable string rather than 64-bits UTC.
    # "last_modify_time" - Last modify time of the datahub subscription. It is the same as *create_time* at the beginning. It is also a human-readable string rather than 64-bits UTC.
}
alicloud-resource-datahub-subscription.description: The subscription is the basic unit of resource usage in Datahub Service under Publish/Subscribe model. You can manage the relationships between user and topics by using subscriptions. [Refer to details](https://help.aliyun.com/document_detail/47440.html).

alicloud-resource-datahub-topic.body:
resource "alicloud_datahub_topic" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The name of the datahub topic. Its length is limited to 1-128 and only characters such as letters, digits and '_' are allowed. It is case-insensitive.
    name = ""

    # project_name - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The name of the datahub project that this topic belongs to. It is case-insensitive.
    project_name = ""

    # shard_count - (Optional) The number of shards this topic contains. The permitted range of values is [1, 10]. The default value is 1.
    shard_count = ""

    # life_cycle - (Optional) How many days this topic lives. The permitted range of values is [1, 7]. The default value is 3.
    life_cycle = ""

    # record_type - (Optional) The type of this topic. Its value must be one of {BLOB, TUPLE}. For BLOB topic, data will be organized as binary and encoded by BASE64. For TUPLE topic, data has fixed schema. The default value is "TUPLE" with a schema {STRING}.
    record_type = ""

    # record_schema - (Optional) Schema of this topic, required only for TUPLE topic. Supported data types (case-insensitive) are:
    record_schema = ""

    # comment - (Optional) Comment of the datahub topic. It cannot be longer than 255 characters.
    comment = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the datahub topic. It was composed of project name and its name, and formats to "<project_name>:<name>".
    # "create_time" - Create time of the datahub topic. It is a human-readable string rather than 64-bits UTC.
    # "last_modify_time" - Last modify time of the datahub topic. It is the same as *create_time* at the beginning. It is also a human-readable string rather than 64-bits UTC.
}
alicloud-resource-datahub-topic.description: The topic is the basic unit of Datahub data source and is used to define one kind of data or stream. It contains a set of subscriptions. You can manage the datahub source of an application by using topics. [Refer to details](https://help.aliyun.com/document_detail/47440.html).

alicloud-resource-db-account.body:
resource "alicloud_db_account" "$1" {
    # password - (Required) Operation password. It may consist of letters, digits, or underlines, with a length of 6 to 32 characters.
    password = ""

    # name - (Required) Operation account requiring a uniqueness check. It may consist of lower case letters, numbers, and underlines, and must start with a letter and have no more than 16 characters.
    name = ""

    # instance_id - (Required) The Id of instance in which account belongs.
    instance_id = ""

    # description - (Optional) Database description. It cannot begin with https://. It must start with a Chinese character or English letter. It can include Chinese and English characters, underlines (_), hyphens (-), and numbers. The length may be 2-256 characters.
    description = ""

    # type - (Optional) Privilege type of account. Normal: Common privilege.
    type = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The current account resource ID. Composed of instance ID and account name with format "<instance_id>:<name>".
    # "instance_id" - The Id of DB instance.
    # "name" - The name of DB account.
    # "description" - The account description.
    # "type" - Privilege type of account.
}
alicloud-resource-db-account.description: Provides an RDS account resource and used to manage databases. A RDS instance supports multiple database account.

alicloud-resource-db-account-privilege.body:
resource "alicloud_db_account_privilege" "$1" {
    # account_name - (Required) A specified account name.
    account_name = ""

    # instance_id - (Required) The Id of instance in which account belongs.
    instance_id = ""

    # privilege - (Optional) The privilege of one account access database. Valid values: ["ReadOnly", "ReadWrite"]. Default to "ReadOnly".
    privilege = ""

    # db_names - (Optional) List of specified database name.
    db_names = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The current account resource ID. Composed of instance ID, account name and privilege with format "<instance_id>:<name>:<privilege>".
    # "instance_id" - The Id of DB instance.
    # "account_name" - The name of DB account.
    # "privilege" - The specified account privilege.
    # "db_names" - List of granted privilege database names.
}
alicloud-resource-db-account-privilege.description: Provides an RDS account privilege resource and used to grant several database some access privilege. A database can be granted by multiple account.

alicloud-resource-db-backup-policy.body:
resource "alicloud_db_backup_policy" "$1" {
    # instance_id - (Required) The Id of instance that can run database.
    instance_id = ""

    # backup_period - (Optional) DB Instance backup period. Valid values: [Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday]. Default to ["Tuesday", "Thursday", "Saturday"].
    backup_period = ""

    # backup_time - (Optional) DB instance backup time, in the format of HH:mmZ- HH:mmZ. Time setting interval is one hour. Default to "02:00Z-03:00Z". China time is 8 hours behind it.
    backup_time = ""

    # retention_period - (Optional) Instance backup retention days. Valid values: [7-730]. Default to 7.
    retention_period = ""

    # log_backup - (Optional) Whether to backup instance log. Default to true.
    log_backup = ""

    # log_retention_period - (Optional) Instance log backup retention days. Valid values: [7-730]. Default to 7. It can be larger than 'retention_period'.
    log_retention_period = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The current backup policy resource ID. It is same as 'instance_id'.
    # "instance_id" - The Id of DB instance.
    # "backup_period" - DB Instance backup period.
    # "backup_time" - DB instance backup time.
    # "retention_period" - Instance backup retention days.
    # "log_backup" - Whether to backup instance log.
    # "log_retention_period" - Instance log backup retention days.
}
alicloud-resource-db-backup-policy.description: Provides an RDS instance backup policy resource and used to configure instance backup policy. ~> **NOTE:** Each DB instance has a backup policy and it will be set default values when destroying the resource.

alicloud-resource-db-connection.body:
resource "alicloud_db_connection" "$1" {
    # instance_id - (Required) The Id of instance that can run database.
    instance_id = ""

    # connection_prefix - (Optional) Prefix of an Internet connection string. It must be checked for uniqueness. It may consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and underlines, and must start with a letter and have no more than 30 characters. Default to <instance_id> + 'tf'.
    connection_prefix = ""

    # port - (Optional) Internet connection port. Valid value: [3001-3999]. Default to 3306.
    port = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The current instance connection resource ID. Composed of instance ID and connection string with format "<instance_id>:<connection_prefix>".
    # "connection_prefix" - Prefix of a connection string.
    # "port" - Connection instance port.
    # "connection_string" - Connection instance string.
    # "ip_address" - The ip address of connection string.
}
alicloud-resource-db-connection.description:
Provides an RDS connection resource to allocate an Internet connection string for RDS instance. ~> **NOTE:** Each RDS instance will allocate a intranet connnection string automatically and its prifix is RDS instance ID.
 To avoid unnecessary conflict, please specified a internet connection prefix before applying the resource.

alicloud-resource-db-database.body:
resource "alicloud_db_database" "$1" {
    # character_set - (Required) Character set. The value range is limited to the following: MySQL: [ utf8, gbk, latin1, utf8mb4 ] \(`utf8mb4` only supports versions 5.5 and 5.6\).
    character_set = ""

    # character_set - (Required) Character set. The value range is limited to the following: MySQL: [ utf8, gbk, latin1, utf8mb4 ] \(`utf8mb4` only supports versions 5.5 and 5.6\).
    character_set = ""

    # character_set - (Required) Character set. The value range is limited to the following: MySQL: [ utf8, gbk, latin1, utf8mb4 ] \(`utf8mb4` only supports versions 5.5 and 5.6\).
    character_set = ""

    # name - (Required) Name of the database requiring a uniqueness check. It may consist of lower case letters, numbers, and underlines, and must start with a letter
    name = ""

    # instance_id - (Required) The Id of instance that can run database.
    instance_id = ""

    # description - (Optional) Database description. It cannot begin with https://. It must start with a Chinese character or English letter. It can include Chinese and English characters, underlines (_), hyphens (-), and numbers. The length may be 2-256 characters.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The current database resource ID. Composed of instance ID and database name with format "<instance_id>:<name>".
    # "description" - (Optional) Database description. It cannot begin with https://. It must start with a Chinese character or English letter. It can include Chinese and English characters, underlines (_), hyphens (-), and numbers. The length may be 2-256 characters.
    # "instance_id" - The Id of DB instance.
    # "description" - (Optional) Database description. It cannot begin with https://. It must start with a Chinese character or English letter. It can include Chinese and English characters, underlines (_), hyphens (-), and numbers. The length may be 2-256 characters.
    # "name" - The name of DB database.
    # "description" - (Optional) Database description. It cannot begin with https://. It must start with a Chinese character or English letter. It can include Chinese and English characters, underlines (_), hyphens (-), and numbers. The length may be 2-256 characters.
    # "character_set" - Character set that database used.
    # "description" - (Optional) Database description. It cannot begin with https://. It must start with a Chinese character or English letter. It can include Chinese and English characters, underlines (_), hyphens (-), and numbers. The length may be 2-256 characters.
    # "description" - The database description.
    # "description" - (Optional) Database description. It cannot begin with https://. It must start with a Chinese character or English letter. It can include Chinese and English characters, underlines (_), hyphens (-), and numbers. The length may be 2-256 characters.
}
alicloud-resource-db-database.description:
Provides an RDS database resource. A DB database deployed in a DB instance. A DB instance can own multiple databases. -> **NOTE:** This resource does not support creating 'PostgreSQL' database and
you can use [Postgresql Provider](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/postgresql/index.html) to do it. -> **NOTE:** This resource does not support creating 'PPAS' database. You have to login RDS instance to create manually.

alicloud-resource-db-instance.body:
resource "alicloud_db_instance" "$1" {
    # instance_storage - (Required) User-defined DB instance storage space. Value range: [5, 2000] for MySQL/PostgreSQL/PPAS HA dual node edition;
    instance_storage = ""

    # instance_storage - (Required) User-defined DB instance storage space. Value range: [5, 2000] for MySQL/PostgreSQL/PPAS HA dual node edition;
    instance_storage = ""

    # instance_storage - (Required) User-defined DB instance storage space. Value range: [5, 2000] for MySQL/PostgreSQL/PPAS HA dual node edition;
    instance_storage = ""

    # instance_storage - (Required) User-defined DB instance storage space. Value range: [5, 2000] for MySQL/PostgreSQL/PPAS HA dual node edition;
    instance_storage = ""

    # instance_storage - (Required) User-defined DB instance storage space. Value range: [5, 2000] for MySQL/PostgreSQL/PPAS HA dual node edition;
    instance_storage = ""

    # instance_type - (Required) DB Instance type. For details, see [Instance type table](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/26312.htm).
    instance_type = ""

    # engine_version - (Required) Database version. Value options can refer to the latest docs [CreateDBInstance](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/26228.htm) `EngineVersion`.
    engine_version = ""

    # engine - (Required) Database type. Value options: MySQL, SQLServer, PostgreSQL, and PPAS.
    engine = ""

    # db_instance_class - (Optional) (Deprecated) It has been deprecated from version 1.5.0 and use 'instance_type' to replace.
    db_instance_class = ""

    # db_instance_storage - (Optional) (Deprecated) It has been deprecated from version 1.5.0 and use 'instance_storage' to replace.
    db_instance_storage = ""

    # instance_name - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    instance_name = ""

    # instance_charge_type - (Optional) Valid values are `Prepaid`, `Postpaid`, Default to `Postpaid`.
    instance_charge_type = ""

    # instance_name - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    instance_name = ""

    # period - (Optional) The duration that you will buy DB instance (in month). It is valid when instance_charge_type is `PrePaid`. Valid values: [1~9], 12, 24, 36. Default to 1.
    period = ""

    # instance_name - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    instance_name = ""

    # zone_id - (Optional) The Zone to launch the DB instance. From version 1.8.1, it supports multiple zone.
    zone_id = ""

    # instance_name - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    instance_name = ""

    # multi_az - (Optional) It has been deprecated from version 1.8.1, and `zone_id` can support multiple zone.
    multi_az = ""

    # instance_name - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    instance_name = ""

    # db_instance_net_type - (Optional) (Deprecated) It has been deprecated from version 1.5.0. If you want to set public connection, please use new resource `alicloud_db_connection`. Default to Intranet.
    db_instance_net_type = ""

    # instance_name - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    instance_name = ""

    # allocate_public_connection - (Optional) (Deprecated) It has been deprecated from version 1.5.0. If you want to allocate public connection string, please use new resource `alicloud_db_connection`.
    allocate_public_connection = ""

    # instance_name - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    instance_name = ""

    # instance_network_type - (Optional) (Deprecated) It has been deprecated from version 1.5.0. If you want to create instances in VPC network, this parameter must be set.
    instance_network_type = ""

    # instance_name - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    instance_name = ""

    # vswitch_id - (Optional) The virtual switch ID to launch DB instances in one VPC.
    vswitch_id = ""

    # instance_name - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    instance_name = ""

    # master_user_name - (Optional) (Deprecated) It has been deprecated from version 1.5.0. New resource `alicloud_db_account` field 'name' replaces it.
    master_user_name = ""

    # instance_name - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    instance_name = ""

    # master_user_password - (Optional) (Deprecated) It has been deprecated from version 1.5.0. New resource `alicloud_db_account` field 'password' replaces it.
    master_user_password = ""

    # instance_name - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    instance_name = ""

    # preferred_backup_period - (Optional) (Deprecated) It has been deprecated from version 1.5.0. New resource `alicloud_db_backup_policy` field 'backup_period' replaces it.
    preferred_backup_period = ""

    # instance_name - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    instance_name = ""

    # preferred_backup_time - (Optional) (Deprecated) It has been deprecated from version 1.5.0. New resource `alicloud_db_backup_policy` field 'backup_time' replaces it.
    preferred_backup_time = ""

    # instance_name - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    instance_name = ""

    # backup_retention_period - (Optional) (Deprecated) It has been deprecated from version 1.5.0. New resource `alicloud_db_backup_policy` field 'retention_period' replaces it.
    backup_retention_period = ""

    # instance_name - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    instance_name = ""

    # security_ips - (Optional) List of IP addresses allowed to access all databases of an instance. The list contains up to 1,000 IP addresses, separated by commas. Supported formats include 0.0.0.0/0, 10.23.12.24 (IP), and 10.23.12.24/24 (Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) mode. /24 represents the length of the prefix in an IP address. The range of the prefix length is [1,32]).
    security_ips = ""

    # instance_name - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    instance_name = ""

    # db_mappings - (Optional) (Deprecated) It has been deprecated from version 1.5.0. New resource `alicloud_db_database` replaces it.
    db_mappings = ""

    # instance_name - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    instance_name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The RDS instance ID.
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "instance_charge_type" - The instance charge type.
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "period" - The DB instance using duration.
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "engine" - Database type.
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "engine_version" - The database engine version.
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "db_instance_class" - (Deprecated from version 1.5.0)
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "instance_type" - The RDS instance type.
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "db_instance_storage" - (Deprecated from version 1.5.0)
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "instance_storage" - The RDS instance storage space.
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "instance_name" - The name of DB instance.
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "port" - RDS database connection port.
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "connection_string" - RDS database connection string.
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "zone_id" - The zone ID of the RDS instance.
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "db_instance_net_type" - (Deprecated from version 1.5.0).
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "instance_network_type" - (Deprecated from version 1.5.0).
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "db_mappings" - - (Deprecated from version 1.5.0).
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "preferred_backup_period" - (Deprecated from version 1.5.0).
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "preferred_backup_time" - (Deprecated from version 1.5.0).
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "backup_retention_period" - (Deprecated from version 1.5.0).
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "security_ips" - Security ips of instance whitelist.
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "connections" - (Deprecated from version 1.5.0).
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "vswitch_id" - If the rds instance created in VPC, then this value is virtual switch ID.
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "master_user_name" - (Deprecated from version 1.5.0).
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "preferred_backup_period" - (Deprecated from version 1.5.0).
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "preferred_backup_time" - (Deprecated from version 1.5.0).
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    # "backup_retention_period" - (Deprecated from version 1.5.0).
    # "instance_name" - (Optional) The name of DB instance. It a string of 2 to 256 characters.
}
alicloud-resource-db-instance.description:
Provides an RDS instance resource. A DB instance is an isolated database
environment in the cloud. A DB instance can contain multiple user-created
databases.

alicloud-resource-disk.body:
resource "alicloud_disk" "$1" {
    # size - (Required) The size of the disk in GiBs. When resize the disk, the new size must be greater than the former value, or you would get an error `InvalidDiskSize.TooSmall`.
    size = ""

    # availability_zone - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The Zone to create the disk in.
    availability_zone = ""

    # name - (Optional) Name of the ECS disk. This name can have a string of 2 to 128 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphens, such as "-",".","_", and must not begin or end with a hyphen, and must not begin with http:// or https://. Default value is null.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) Description of the disk. This description can have a string of 2 to 256 characters, It cannot begin with http:// or https://. Default value is null.
    description = ""

    # category - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) Category of the disk. Valid values are `cloud`, `cloud_efficiency` and `cloud_ssd`. Default is `cloud_efficiency`.
    category = ""

    # snapshot_id - (Optional) A snapshot to base the disk off of. If the disk size required by snapshot is greater than `size`, the `size` will be ignored.
    snapshot_id = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # encrypted - (Optional) If true, the disk will be encrypted
    encrypted = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The disk ID.
    # "availability_zone" - The Zone to create the disk in.
    # "name" - The disk name.
    # "description" - The disk description.
    # "status" - The disk status.
    # "category" - The disk category.
    # "size" - The disk size.
    # "snapshot_id" - The disk snapshot ID.
    # "tags" - The disk tags.
    # "encrypted" - Whether the disk is encrypted.
}
alicloud-resource-disk.description: Provides a ECS disk resource. ~> **NOTE:** One of `size` or `snapshot_id` is required when specifying an ECS disk. If all of them be specified, `size` must more than the size of snapshot which `snapshot_id` represents. Currently, `alicloud_disk` doesn't resize disk.

alicloud-resource-disk-attachment.body:
resource "alicloud_disk_attachment" "$1" {
    # instance_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) ID of the Instance to attach to.
    instance_id = ""

    # disk_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) ID of the Disk to be attached.
    disk_id = ""

    # device_name - (Optional) (Deprecated) The device name has been deprecated, and when attaching disk, it will be allocated automatically by system according to default order from /dev/xvdb to /dev/xvdz.
    device_name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "instance_id" - ID of the Instance.
    # "disk_id" - ID of the Disk.
    # "device_name" - The device name exposed to the instance.
}
alicloud-resource-disk-attachment.description: Provides an Alicloud ECS Disk Attachment as a resource, to attach and detach disks from ECS Instances.

alicloud-resource-dns.body:
resource "alicloud_dns" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Name of the domain. This name without suffix can have a string of 1 to 63 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or "-", and must not begin or end with "-", and "-" must not in the 3th and 4th character positions at the same time. Suffix `.sh` and `.tel` are not supported.
    name = ""

    # group_id - (Optional) Id of the group in which the domain will add. If not supplied, then use default group.
    group_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The domain id.
    # "name" - The domain name.
    # "group_id" - The group id of domain.
    # "dns_server" - A list of the dns server name.
}
alicloud-resource-dns.description: Provides a DNS resource. ~> **NOTE:** The domain name which you want to add must be already registered and had not added by another account. Every domain name can only exist in a unique group.

alicloud-resource-dns-group.body:
resource "alicloud_dns_group" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Name of the domain group.    
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The group id.
    # "name" - The group name.
}

alicloud-resource-dns-record.body:
resource "alicloud_dns_record" "$1" {
    # value - (Required) The value of domain record.
    value = ""

    # type - (Required) The type of domain record. Valid values are `A`,`NS`,`MX`,`TXT`,`CNAME`,`SRV`,`AAAA`,`REDIRECT_URL` and `FORWORD_URL`.
    type = ""

    # host_record - (Required) Host record for the domain record. This host_record can have at most 253 characters, and each part split with "." can have at most 63 characters, and must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphens, such as "-",".","*","@",  and must not begin or end with "-".
    host_record = ""

    # name - (Required) Name of the domain. This name without suffix can have a string of 1 to 63 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or "-", and must not begin or end with "-", and "-" must not in the 3th and 4th character positions at the same time. Suffix `.sh` and `.tel` are not supported.
    name = ""

    # ttl - (Optional) The effective time of domain record. Its scope depends on the edition of the cloud resolution. Free is `[600, 86400]`, Basic is `[120, 86400]`, Standard is `[60, 86400]`, Ultimate is `[10, 86400]`, Exclusive is `[1, 86400]`. Default value is `600`.
    ttl = ""

    # priority - (Optional) The priority of domain record. Valid values are `[1-10]`. When the `type` is `MX`, this parameter is required.
    priority = ""

    # routing - (Optional) The parsing line of domain record. Valid values are `default`, `telecom`, `unicom`, `mobile`, `oversea` and `edu`. When the `type` is `FORWORD_URL`, this parameter must be `default`. Default value is `default`.
    routing = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The record id.
    # "name" - (Required) The record domain name.
    # "type" - (Required) The record type.
    # "host_record" - The host record of record.
    # "value" - The record value.
    # "ttl" - The record effective time.
    # "priority" - The record priority.
    # "routing" - The record parsing line.
    # "status" - The record status. "Enable" or "Disable".
    # "Locked" - The record locked state. "true" or "false".
}

alicloud-resource-drds-instance.body:
resource "alicloud_drds_instance" "$1" {
    # description - (Required) Description of the DRDS instance, This description can have a string of 2 to 256 characters.
    description = ""

    # zone_id - (Optional) (Optional, ForceNew) The Zone to launch the DRDS instance.
    zone_id = ""

    # instance_charge_type - (Optional)  (Optional, ForceNew) Valid values are `PrePaid`, `PostPaid`, Default to `PostPaid`.
    instance_charge_type = ""

    # vswitch_id - (Optional) (Optional, ForceNew) The VSwitch ID to launch in.
    vswitch_id = ""

    # instance_series - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) User-defined DRDS instance node spec. Value range:
    instance_series = ""

    # specification - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) User-defined DRDS instance specification. Value range:
    specification = ""

    # id - (Optional) The DRDS instance ID.
    id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
alicloud-resource-drds-instance.description:
Distributed Relational Database Service (DRDS) is a lightweight (stateless), flexible, stable, and efficient middleware product independently developed by Alibaba Group to resolve scalability issues with single-host relational databases.
With its compatibility with MySQL protocols and syntaxes, DRDS enables database/table sharding, smooth scaling, configuration upgrade/downgrade,
transparent read/write splitting, and distributed transactions, providing O&M capabilities for distributed databases throughout their entire lifecycle. For information about DRDS and how to use it, see [What is DRDS](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/29659.htm). -> **NOTE:** At present, DRDS instance only can be supported in the regions: cn-shenzhen, cn-beijing, cn-hangzhou, cn-hongkong, cn-qingdao.

alicloud-resource-eip.body:
resource "alicloud_eip" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) The name of the EIP instance. This name can have a string of 2 to 128 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphens, such as "-",".","_", and must not begin or end with a hyphen, and must not begin with http:// or https://.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) Description of the EIP instance, This description can have a string of 2 to 256 characters, It cannot begin with http:// or https://. Default value is null.
    description = ""

    # bandwidth - (Optional) Maximum bandwidth to the elastic public network, measured in Mbps (Mega bit per second). If this value is not specified, then automatically sets it to 5 Mbps.
    bandwidth = ""

    # internet_charge_type - (Optional) (Optional, ForceNew) Internet charge type of the EIP, Valid values are `PayByBandwidth`, `PayByTraffic`. Default to `PayByBandwidth`. From version `1.7.1`, default to `PayByTraffic`.
    internet_charge_type = ""

    # instance_charge_type - (Optional) (Optional, ForceNew) Elastic IP instance charge type. Valid values are "PrePaid" and "PostPaid". Default to "PostPaid".
    instance_charge_type = ""

    # period - (Optional) (Optional, ForceNew) The duration that you will buy the resource, in month. It is valid when `instance_charge_type` is `PrePaid`.
    period = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The EIP ID.
    # "bandwidth" - The elastic public network bandwidth.
    # "internet_charge_type" - The EIP internet charge type.
    # "status" - The EIP current status.
    # "ip_address" - The elastic ip address
}
alicloud-resource-eip.description:
Provides an elastic IP resource. -> **NOTE:** The resource only support to create `PayByTraffic` elastic IP for international account. Otherwise, you will happened error `COMMODITY.INVALID_COMPONENT`.
Your account is international if you can use it to login in [International Web Console](https://account.alibabacloud.com/login/login.htm). -> **NOTE:** From version 1.10.1, this resource supports creating "PrePaid" EIP. In addition, it supports setting EIP name and description.

alicloud-resource-eip-association.body:
resource "alicloud_eip_association" "$1" {
    # allocation_id - (Optional) (Required, ForcesNew) The allocation EIP ID.
    allocation_id = ""

    # instance_id - (Optional) (Required, ForcesNew) The ID of the ECS or SLB instance or Nat Gateway.
    instance_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "allocation_id" - As above.
    # "instance_id" - As above.
}
alicloud-resource-eip-association.description:
Provides an Alicloud EIP Association resource for associating Elastic IP to ECS Instance, SLB Instance or Nat Gateway. ~> **NOTE:** `alicloud_eip_association` is useful in scenarios where EIPs are either
 pre-existing or distributed to customers or users and therefore cannot be changed. ~> **NOTE:** From version 1.7.1, the resource support to associate EIP to SLB Instance or Nat Gateway. ~> **NOTE:** One EIP can only be associated with ECS or SLB instance which in the VPC.

alicloud-resource-ess-alarm.body:
resource "alicloud_ess_alarm" "$1" {
    # threshold - (Required) The value against which the specified statistics is compared.
    threshold = ""

    # metric_name - (Required) The name for the alarm's associated metric.
    metric_name = ""

    # scaling_group_id - (Required) The scaling group associated with this alarm.
    scaling_group_id = ""

    # alarm_actions - (Required) The list of actions to execute when this alarm transition into an ALARM state. Each action is specified as ess scaling rule ari.
    alarm_actions = ""

    # name - (Optional) The name for ess alarm.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) The description for the alarm.
    description = ""

    # metric_type - (Optional) The type for the alarm's associated metric. Supported value: system, custom. "system" means the metric data is collected by Aliyun Cloud Monitor Service(CMS), "custom" means the metric data is upload to CMS by users. Defaults to system. 
    metric_type = ""

    # period - (Optional) The period in seconds over which the specified statistic is applied. Supported value: 60, 120, 300, 900. Defaults to 300.
    period = ""

    # statistics - (Optional) The statistic to apply to the alarm's associated metric. Supported value: Average, Minimum, Maximum. Defaults to Average.
    statistics = ""

    # comparison_operator - (Optional) The arithmetic operation to use when comparing the specified Statistic and Threshold. The specified Statistic value is used as the first operand. Supported value: >=, <=, >, <. Defaults to >=.
    comparison_operator = ""

    # evaluation_count - (Optional) The number of times that needs to satisfies comparison condition before transition into ALARM state. Defaults to 3.
    evaluation_count = ""

    # cloud_monitor_group_id - (Optional) Defines the application group id defined by CMS which is assigned when you upload custom metric to CMS, only available for custom metirc.
    cloud_monitor_group_id = ""

    # dimensions - (Optional) The dimension map for the alarm's associated metric (documented below). For all metrics, you can not set the dimension key as "scaling_group" or "userId", which is set by default, the second dimension for metric, such as "device" for "PackagesNetIn", need to be set by users.
    dimensions = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
alicloud-resource-ess-alarm.description: Provides a ESS alarm task resource.

alicloud-resource-ess-attachment.body:
resource "alicloud_ess_attachment" "$1" {
    # instance_ids - (Required) ID of the ECS instance to be attached to the scaling group. You can input up to 20 IDs.
    instance_ids = ""

    # scaling_group_id - (Required) ID of the scaling group of a scaling configuration.
    scaling_group_id = ""

    # force - (Optional) Whether to remove forcibly "AutoCreated" ECS instances in order to release scaling group capacity "MaxSize" for attaching ECS instances. Default to false.
    force = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ESS attachment resource ID.
    # "instance_ids" - ID of list "Attached" ECS instance.
    # "force" - Whether to delete "AutoCreated" ECS instances.
}
alicloud-resource-ess-attachment.description: Attaches several ECS instances to a specified scaling group or remove them from it. ~> **NOTE:** ECS instances can be attached or remove only when the scaling group is active and it has no scaling activity in progress. ~> **NOTE:** There are two types ECS instances in a scaling group: "AutoCreated" and "Attached". The total number of them can not larger than the scaling group "MaxSize".

alicloud-resource-ess-lifecycle-hook.body:
resource "alicloud_ess_lifecycle_hook" "$1" {
    # lifecycle_transition - (Required) Type of Scaling activity attached to lifecycle hook. Supported value: SCALE_OUT, SCALE_IN.
    lifecycle_transition = ""

    # scaling_group_id - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The ID of the Auto Scaling group to which you want to assign the lifecycle hook.
    scaling_group_id = ""

    # name - (Optional) (Optional, ForceNew) The name of the lifecycle hook, which is a string containing 2 to 40 English or Chinese characters. If this parameter value is not specified, the default value is lifecycle hook id.
    name = ""

    # heartbeat_timeout - (Optional) Defines the amount of time, in seconds, that can elapse before the lifecycle hook times out. When the lifecycle hook times out, Auto Scaling performs the action defined in the default_result parameter. Default value: 600.
    heartbeat_timeout = ""

    # default_result - (Optional) Defines the action the Auto Scaling group should take when the lifecycle hook timeout elapses. Applicable value: CONTINUE, ABANDON, default value: CONTINUE.
    default_result = ""

    # notification_arn - (Optional) The Arn of notification target.
    notification_arn = ""

    # notification_metadata - (Optional) Additional information that you want to include when Auto Scaling sends a message to the notification target.
    notification_metadata = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
alicloud-resource-ess-lifecycle-hook.description: Provides a ESS lifecycle hook resource. More about Ess lifecycle hook, see [LifecycleHook](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/73839.htm).

alicloud-resource-ess-scaling-configurat.body:
resource "alicloud_ess_scaling_configuration" "$1" {
    # security_group_id - (Required) ID of the security group to which a newly created instance belongs.
    security_group_id = ""

    # instance_type - (Required) Resource type of an ECS instance.
    instance_type = ""

    # image_id - (Required) ID of an image file, indicating the image resource selected when an instance is enabled.
    image_id = ""

    # scaling_group_id - (Required) ID of the scaling group of a scaling configuration.
    scaling_group_id = ""

    # instance_name - (Optional) Name of an ECS instance. Default to "ESS-Instance". It is valid from version 1.7.1.
    instance_name = ""

    # io_optimized - (Optional) (Deprecated) It has been deprecated on instance resource. All the launched alicloud instances will be I/O optimized.
    io_optimized = ""

    # is_outdated - (Optional) Whether to use outdated instance type. Default to false.
    is_outdated = ""

    # scaling_configuration_name - (Optional) Name shown for the scheduled task. If this parameter value is not specified, the default value is ScalingConfigurationId.
    scaling_configuration_name = ""

    # internet_charge_type - (Optional) Network billing type, Values: PayByBandwidth or PayByTraffic. Default to `PayByBandwidth`.
    internet_charge_type = ""

    # internet_max_bandwidth_in - (Optional) Maximum incoming bandwidth from the public network, measured in Mbps (Mega bit per second). The value range is [1,200].
    internet_max_bandwidth_in = ""

    # internet_max_bandwidth_out - (Optional) Maximum outgoing bandwidth from the public network, measured in Mbps (Mega bit per second). The value range for PayByBandwidth is [0,100].
    internet_max_bandwidth_out = ""

    # system_disk_category - (Optional) Category of the system disk. The parameter value options are `cloud_efficiency`, `cloud_ssd` and `cloud`. `cloud` only is used to some no I/O optimized instance. Default to `cloud_efficiency`.
    system_disk_category = ""

    # system_disk_size - (Optional) Size of system disk, in GiB. Optional values: cloud: 40-500, cloud_efficiency: 40-500, cloud_ssd: 40-500, ephemeral_ssd: 40-500 The default value is {40, ImageSize}. If this parameter is set, the system disk size must be greater than or equal to max{40, ImageSize}.
    system_disk_size = ""

    # enable - (Optional) Whether enable the specified scaling group(make it active) to which the current scaling configuration belongs.
    enable = ""

    # active - (Optional) Whether active current scaling configuration in the specified scaling group. Default to `false`.
    active = ""

    # substitute - (Optional) The another scaling configuration which will be active automatically and replace current configuration when setting `active` to 'false'. It is invalid when `active` is 'true'.
    substitute = ""
