    endpoint = ""

    # endpoint - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The endpoint has three format. Available values format: HTTP Format: http://xxx.com/xxx
    endpoint = ""

    # endpoint - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The endpoint has three format. Available values format: HTTP Format: http://xxx.com/xxx
    endpoint = ""

    # filter_tag - (Optional) (Optional, ForceNew) The length should be shorter than 16.
    filter_tag = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the topic subscription.Format to topic_name:name
    # "filter_tag" - (Optional, ForceNew) The length should be shorter than 16.
}
alicloud-resource-mns-topic_subscription.description: Provides a MNS topic subscription resource. ~> **NOTE:** Terraform will auto build a mns topic subscription  while it uses `alicloud_mns_topic_subscription` to build a mns topic subscription resource.

alicloud-resource-nat-gateway.body:
resource "alicloud_nat_gateway" "$1" {
    # vpc_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces New Resorce) The VPC ID.
    vpc_id = ""

    # spec - (Optional) (Deprecated) It has been deprecated from provider version 1.7.1, and new field 'specification' can replace it.
    spec = ""

    # specification - (Optional) The specification of the nat gateway. Valid values are `Small`, `Middle` and `Large`. Default to `Small`. Details refer to [Nat Gateway Specification](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/42757.htm).
    specification = ""

    # name - (Optional) Name of the nat gateway. The value can have a string of 2 to 128 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphens, such as "-",".","_", and must not begin or end with a hyphen, and must not begin with http:// or https://. Defaults to null.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) Description of the nat gateway, This description can have a string of 2 to 256 characters, It cannot begin with http:// or https://. Defaults to null.
    description = ""

    # bandwidth_packages - (Optional) A list of bandwidth packages for the nat gatway. Only support nat gateway created before 00:00 on November 4, 2017. Available in v1.13.0+ and v1.7.1-.
    bandwidth_packages = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the nat gateway.
    # "name" - The name of the nat gateway.
    # "description" - The description of the nat gateway.
    # "spec" - It has been deprecated from provider version 1.7.1.
    # "specification" - The specification of the nat gateway.
    # "vpc_id" - The VPC ID for the nat gateway.
    # "bandwidth_package_ids" - A list ID of the bandwidth packages, and split them with commas.
    # "snat_table_ids" - The nat gateway will auto create a snap and forward item, the "snat_table_ids" is the created one.
    # "forward_table_ids" - The nat gateway will auto create a snap and forward item, the "forward_table_ids" is the created one.
}
alicloud-resource-nat-gateway.description:
Provides a resource to create a VPC NAT Gateway. ~> **NOTE:** Resource bandwidth packages will not be supported since 00:00 on November 4, 2017, and public IP can be replaced be elastic IPs.
If a Nat Gateway has already bought some bandwidth packages, it can not bind elastic IP and you have to submit the [work order](https://selfservice.console.aliyun.com/ticket/createIndex) to solve.
If you want to add public IP, you can use resource 'alicloud_eip_association' to bind several elastic IPs for one Nat Gateway. ~> **NOTE:** From version 1.7.1, this resource has deprecated bandwidth packages.
But, in order to manage stock bandwidth packages, version 1.13.0 re-support configuring 'bandwidth_packages'.

alicloud-resource-network-interface.body:
resource "alicloud_network_interface" "$1" {
    # vswitch_id - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The VSwitch to create the ENI in.
    vswitch_id = ""

    # security_groups - (Optional) (Require) A list of security group ids to associate with.
    security_groups = ""

    # private_ip - (Optional) The primary private IP of the ENI.
    private_ip = ""

    # name - (Optional) Name of the ENI. This name can have a string of 2 to 128 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphens, such as "-", ".", "_", and must not begin or end with a hyphen, and must not begin with http:// or https://. Default value is null.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) Description of the ENI. This description can have a string of 2 to 256 characters, It cannot begin with http:// or https://. Default value is null.
    description = ""

    # private_ips - (Optional) List of secondary private IPs to assign to the ENI. Don't use both private_ips and private_ips_count in the same ENI resource block.
    private_ips = ""

    # private_ips_count - (Optional) Number of secondary private IPs to assign to the ENI. Don't use both private_ips and private_ips_count in the same ENI resource block.
    private_ips_count = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ENI ID.
}
alicloud-resource-network-interface.description: Provides an ECS Elastic Network Interface resource. For information about Elastic Network Interface and how to use it, see [Elastic Network Interface](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/58496.html). ~> **NOTE** Only one of private_ips or private_ips_count can be specified when assign private IPs.

alicloud-resource-network-interface-atta.body:
resource "alicloud_network_interface_attachment" "$1" {
    # instance_id - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The instance ID to attach.
    instance_id = ""

    # network_interface_id - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The ENI ID to attach.
    network_interface_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the resource, formatted as "<network_interface_id>:<instance_id>".
}
alicloud-resource-network-interface-atta.description: Provides an Alicloud ECS Elastic Network Interface Attachment as a resource to attach ENI to or detach ENI from ECS Instances. For information about Elastic Network Interface and how to use it, see [Elastic Network Interface](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/58496.html).

alicloud-resource-oss-bucket.body:
resource "alicloud_oss_bucket" "$1" {
    # bucket - (Optional) (Optional, Forces New Resorce) The name of the bucket. If omitted, Terraform will assign a random and unique name.
    bucket = ""

    # acl - (Optional) The [canned ACL](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/31898.htm) to apply. Defaults to "private".
    acl = ""

    # cors_rule - (Optional) A list rules of [Cross-Origin Resource Sharing](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/31903.htm) (documented below). The items of cors rule are no more than 10 for every OSS bucket.
    cors_rule = ""

    # website - (Optional) A list website objects(documented below). The items of website are no more than 1 for every OSS bucket.
    website = ""

    # logging - (Optional) A list settings of [bucket logging](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/31900.htm) (documented below). The items of logging are no more than 1 for every OSS bucket.
    logging = ""

    # logging_isenable - (Optional) The flag of using logging enable container. Defaults true.
    logging_isenable = ""

    # referer_config - (Optional) A list configurations of [referer](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/31901.htm) (documented below). The items of referer_config are no more than 1 for every OSS bucket.
    referer_config = ""

    # lifecycle_rule - (Optional) A list configurations of [object lifecycle management](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/31904.htm) (documented below). The items of rules are no more than 1000 for every OSS bucket.
    lifecycle_rule = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The name of the bucket.
    # "acl" - The acl of the bucket.
    # "creation_date" - The creation date of the bucket.
    # "extranet_endpoint" - The extranet access endpoint of the bucket.
    # "intranet_endpoint" - The intranet access endpoint of the bucket.
    # "location" - The location of the bucket.
    # "owner" - The bucket owner.
    # "storage_class" - The bucket storage type.
}
alicloud-resource-oss-bucket.description: Provides a resource to create a oss bucket and set its attribution. ~> **NOTE:** The bucket namespace is shared by all users of the OSS system. Please set bucket name as unique as possible.

alicloud-resource-oss-bucket-object.body:
resource "alicloud_oss_bucket_object" "$1" {
    # source - (Required) The path to the source file being uploaded to the bucket.
    source = ""

    # key - (Required) The name of the object once it is in the bucket.
    key = ""

    # bucket - (Required) The name of the bucket to put the file in.
    bucket = ""

    # content - (Optional) (Required unless `source` given) The literal content being uploaded to the bucket.
    content = ""

    # acl - (Optional) The [canned ACL](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/52284.htm) to apply. Defaults to "private".
    acl = ""

    # content_type - (Optional) A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data, e.g. application/octet-stream. All Valid MIME Types are valid for this input.
    content_type = ""

    # cache_control - (Optional) Specifies caching behavior along the request/reply chain. Read [RFC2616 Cache-Control](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2616.txt) for further details.
    cache_control = ""

    # content_disposition - (Optional) Specifies presentational information for the object. Read [RFC2616 Content-Disposition](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2616.txt) for further details.
    content_disposition = ""

    # content_encoding - (Optional) Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type referenced by the Content-Type header field. Read [RFC2616 Content-Encoding](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2616.txt) for further details.
    content_encoding = ""

    # expires - (Optional) Specifies expire date for the the request/response. Read [RFC2616 Expires](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2616.txt) for further details.
    expires = ""

    # server_side_encryption - (Optional) Specifies server-side encryption of the object in OSS. At present, it valid value is "`AES256`".
    server_side_encryption = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - the "key" of the resource supplied above.
    # "content_length" - the content length of request.
    # "etag" - the ETag generated for the object (an MD5 sum of the object content).
}
alicloud-resource-oss-bucket-object.description: Provides a resource to put a object(content or file) to a oss bucket.

alicloud-resource-ots-instance.body:
resource "alicloud_ots_instance" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The name of the instance.
    name = ""

    # accessed_by - (Optional) Allow all network to access the instance.
    accessed_by = ""

    # accessed_by - (Optional) Allow all network to access the instance.
    accessed_by = ""

    # instance_type - (Optional) (ForceNew) The type of instance. Valid values are "Capacity" and "HighPerformance". Default to "HighPerformance".
    instance_type = ""

    # description - (Optional) (Optional, ForceNew) The description of the instance. Currently, it does not support modifying.
    description = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the instance.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The resource ID. The value is same as the "name".
    # "ConsoleOrVpc" - Allow web console or the attached VPC to access the instance. Default to "Any".
    # "name" - The instance name.
    # "ConsoleOrVpc" - Allow web console or the attached VPC to access the instance. Default to "Any".
    # "description" - The instance description.
    # "ConsoleOrVpc" - Allow web console or the attached VPC to access the instance. Default to "Any".
    # "accessed_by" - TThe network limitation of accessing instance.
    # "ConsoleOrVpc" - Allow web console or the attached VPC to access the instance. Default to "Any".
    # "instance_type" - The instance type.
    # "ConsoleOrVpc" - Allow web console or the attached VPC to access the instance. Default to "Any".
    # "tags" - The instance tags.
    # "ConsoleOrVpc" - Allow web console or the attached VPC to access the instance. Default to "Any".
}
alicloud-resource-ots-instance.description:
This resource will help you to manager a [Table Store](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/27280.htm) Instance.
It is foundation of creating data table.

alicloud-resource-ots-instance-attachmen.body:
resource "alicloud_ots_instance_attachment" "$1" {
    # instance_name - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The name of the OTS instance.
    instance_name = ""

    # vpc_name - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The name of attaching VPC to instance.
    vpc_name = ""

    # vswitch_id - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The ID of attaching VSwitch to instance.
    vswitch_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The resource ID. The value is same as "instance_name".
    # "instance_name" - The instance name.
    # "vpc_name" - The name of attaching VPC to instance.
    # "vswitch_id" - The ID of attaching VSwitch to instance.
    # "vpc_id" - The ID of attaching VPC to instance.
}
alicloud-resource-ots-instance-attachmen.description: This resource will help you to bind a VPC to an OTS instance.

alicloud-resource-ots-table.body:
resource "alicloud_ots_table" "$1" {
    # max_version - (Required) The maximum number of versions stored in this table. The valid value is 1-2147483647.
    max_version = ""

    # time_to_live - (Required) The retention time of data stored in this table (unit: second). The value maximum is 2147483647 and -1 means never expired.
    time_to_live = ""

    # name - (Required) Name for primary key.
    name = ""

    # instance_name - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The name of the OTS instance in which table will located.
    instance_name = ""

    # table_name - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The table name of the OTS instance. If changed, a new table would be created.
    table_name = ""

    # primary_key - (Optional) (Required, Type: List) The property of `TableMeta` which indicates the structure information of a table. It describes the attribute value of primary key. The number of `primary_key` should not be less than one and not be more than four.
    primary_key = ""

    # type - (Optional) (Required, Type: list) Type for primary key. Only `Integer`, `String` or `Binary` is allowed.
    type = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The resource ID. The value is "<instance_name>:<table_name>".
    # "instance_name" - The OTS instance name.
    # "table_name" - The table name of the OTS which could not be changed.
    # "primary_key" - The property of "TableMeta" which indicates the structure information of a table.
    # "time_to_live" - The retention time of data stored in this table.
    # "max_version" - The maximum number of versions stored in this table.
}
alicloud-resource-ots-table.description:
Provides an OTS table resource. ~> **NOTE:** From Provider version 1.10.0, the provider field 'ots_instance_name' has been deprecated and
you should use resource alicloud_ots_table's new field 'instance_name' and 'table_name' to re-import this resource.

alicloud-resource-pvtz-zone.body:
resource "alicloud_pvtz_zone" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The name of the Private Zone.
    name = ""

    # remark - (Optional) The remark of the Private Zone.
    remark = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the Private Zone.
    # "record_count" - The count of the Private Zone Record.
}
alicloud-resource-pvtz-zone.description: Provides a Private Zone resource. ~> **NOTE:** Terraform will auto Create a Private Zone while it uses `alicloud_pvtz_zone` to build a Private Zone resource.

alicloud-resource-pvtz-zone-attachment.body:
resource "alicloud_pvtz_zone_attachment" "$1" {
    # vpc_ids - (Required) The id List of the VPC, for example:["vpc-1","vpc-2"].
    vpc_ids = ""

    # zone_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The name of the Private Zone Record.
    zone_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the Private Zone VPC Attachment.
}
alicloud-resource-pvtz-zone-attachment.description: Provides vpcs bound to Alicloud Private Zone resource. ~> **NOTE:** Terraform will auto bind vpc to a Private Zone while it uses `alicloud_pvtz_zone_attachment` to build a Private Zone and VPC binding resource.

alicloud-resource-pvtz-zone-record.body:
resource "alicloud_pvtz_zone_record" "$1" {
    # value - (Required) The value of the Private Zone Record.
    value = ""

    # type - (Required) The type of the Private Zone Record. Valid values: A, CNAME, TXT, MX, PTR.
    type = ""

    # resource_record - (Required) The resource record of the Private Zone Record.
    resource_record = ""

    # zone_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The name of the Private Zone Record.
    zone_id = ""

    # ttl - (Optional) The ttl of the Private Zone Record.
    ttl = ""

    # priority - (Optional) The priority of the Private Zone Record. At present, only can "MX" record support it. Valid values: [1-50]. Default to 1.
    priority = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the Private Zone Record.
}
alicloud-resource-pvtz-zone-record.description: Provides a Private Zone Record resource. -> **NOTE:** Terraform will auto Create a Private Zone Record while it uses `alicloud_pvtz_zone_record` to build a Private Zone Record resource.

alicloud-resource-ram-access-key.body:
resource "alicloud_ram_access_key" "$1" {
    # user_name - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) Name of the RAM user. This name can have a string of 1 to 64 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphens, such as "-",".","_", and must not begin with a hyphen.
    user_name = ""

    # secret_file - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) The name of file that can save access key id and access key secret. Strongly suggest you to specified it when you creating access key, otherwise, you wouldn't get its secret ever.
    secret_file = ""

    # status - (Optional) Status of access key. It must be `Active` or `Inactive`. Default value is `Active`.
    status = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The access key ID.
    # "status" - The access key status.
}
alicloud-resource-ram-access-key.description: Provides a RAM User access key resource. ~> **NOTE:**  You should set the `secret_file` if you want to get the access key.

alicloud-resource-ram-account-alias.description: Provides a RAM cloud account alias.

alicloud-resource-ram-alias.description: ~> **NOTE:** This resource has been deprecated from [v1.3.2](https://github.com/alibaba/terraform-provider/releases/tag/V1.3.2). New resource `alicloud_ram_account_alias` will replace.

alicloud-resource-ram-group.body:
resource "alicloud_ram_group" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Name of the RAM group. This name can have a string of 1 to 64 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphen "-", and must not begin with a hyphen.
    name = ""

    # comments - (Optional) Comment of the RAM group. This parameter can have a string of 1 to 128 characters.
    comments = ""

    # force - (Optional) This parameter is used for resource destroy. Default value is `false`.
    force = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The group ID.
    # "name" - The group name.
    # "comments" - The group comments.
}
alicloud-resource-ram-group.description: Provides a RAM Group resource. ~> **NOTE:** When you want to destroy this resource forcefully(means remove all the relationships associated with it automatically and then destroy it) without set `force`  with `true` at beginning, you need add `force = true` to configuration file and run `terraform plan`, then you can delete resource forcefully.

alicloud-resource-ram-group-membership.body:
resource "alicloud_ram_group_membership" "$1" {
    # user_names - (Required) Set of user name which will be added to group. Each name can have a string of 1 to 64 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphens, such as "-",".","_", and must not begin with a hyphen.
    user_names = ""

    # group_name - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) Name of the RAM group. This name can have a string of 1 to 64 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphen "-", and must not begin with a hyphen.
    group_name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The membership ID.
    # "group_name" - The group name.
    # "user_names" - The list of names of users which in the group.
}
alicloud-resource-ram-group-membership.description: Provides a RAM Group membership resource.

alicloud-resource-ram-group-policy-attac.body:
resource "alicloud_ram_group_policy_attachment" "$1" {
    # group_name - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) Name of the RAM group. This name can have a string of 1 to 64 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphen "-", and must not begin with a hyphen.
    group_name = ""

    # policy_name - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) Name of the RAM policy. This name can have a string of 1 to 128 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphen "-", and must not begin with a hyphen.
    policy_name = ""

    # policy_type - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) Type of the RAM policy. It must be `Custom` or `System`.
    policy_type = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The attachment ID.
    # "group_name" - The group name.
    # "policy_name" - The policy name.
    # "policy_type" - The policy type.
}
alicloud-resource-ram-group-policy-attac.description: Provides a RAM Group Policy attachment resource.

alicloud-resource-ram-login-profile.body:
resource "alicloud_ram_login_profile" "$1" {
    # password - (Required) Password of the RAM user.
    password = ""

    # user_name - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) Name of the RAM user. This name can have a string of 1 to 64 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphens, such as "-",".","_", and must not begin with a hyphen.
    user_name = ""

    # mfa_bind_required - (Optional) This parameter indicates whether the MFA needs to be bind when the user first logs in. Default value is `false`.
    mfa_bind_required = ""

    # password_reset_required - (Optional) This parameter indicates whether the password needs to be reset when the user first logs in. Default value is `false`.
    password_reset_required = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The login profile ID.
    # "user_name" - The user name.
    # "mfa_bind_required" - The parameter which indicates whether the MFA needs to be bind when the user first logs in.
    # "password_reset_required" - The parameter which indicates whether the password needs to be reset when the user first logs in.
}
alicloud-resource-ram-login-profile.description: Provides a RAM User Login Profile resource.

alicloud-resource-ram-policy.body:
resource "alicloud_ram_policy" "$1" {
    # effect - (Required) This parameter indicates whether or not the `action` is allowed. Valid values are `Allow` and `Deny`.
    effect = ""

    # name - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) Name of the RAM policy. This name can have a string of 1 to 128 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphen "-", and must not begin with a hyphen.
    name = ""

    # statement - (Optional) (Optional,  Type: list, Conflicts with `document`) Statements of the RAM policy document. It is required when the `document` is not specified.
    statement = ""

    # resource - (Optional) (Required, Type: list) List of specific objects which will be authorized. The format of each item in this list is `acs:${service}:${region}:${account_id}:${relative_id}`, such as `acs:ecs:*:*:instance/inst-002` and `acs:oss:*:1234567890000:mybucket`. The `${service}` can be `ecs`, `oss`, `ots` and so on, the `${region}` is the region info which can use `*` replace when it is not supplied, the `${account_id}` refers to someone's Alicloud account id or you can use `*` to replace, the `${relative_id}` is the resource description section which related to the `${service}`.
    resource = ""

    # action - (Optional) (Required, Type: list) List of operations for the `resource`. The format of each item in this list is `${service}:${action_name}`, such as `oss:ListBuckets` and `ecs:Describe*`. The `${service}` can be `ecs`, `oss`, `ots` and so on, the `${action_name}` refers to the name of an api interface which related to the `${service}`.
    action = ""

    # version - (Optional) (Optional, Conflicts with `document`) Version of the RAM policy document. Valid value is `1`. Default value is `1`.
    version = ""

    # document - (Optional) (Optional, Conflicts with `statement` and `version`) Document of the RAM policy. It is required when the `statement` is not specified.
    document = ""

    # description - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) Description of the RAM policy. This name can have a string of 1 to 1024 characters.
    description = ""

    # force - (Optional) This parameter is used for resource destroy. Default value is `false`.
    force = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The policy ID.
    # "name" - The policy name.
    # "type" - The policy type.
    # "description" - The policy description.
    # "statement" - List of statement of the policy document.
    # "document" - The policy document.
    # "version" - The policy document version.
    # "attachment_count" - The policy attachment count.
}
alicloud-resource-ram-policy.description: Provides a RAM Policy resource.  ~> **NOTE:** When you want to destroy this resource forcefully(means remove all the relationships associated with it automatically and then destroy it) without set `force`  with `true` at beginning, you need add `force = true` to configuration file and run `terraform plan`, then you can delete resource forcefully.

alicloud-resource-ram-role.body:
resource "alicloud_ram_role" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) Name of the RAM role. This name can have a string of 1 to 64 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphens, such as "-", "_", and must not begin with a hyphen.
    name = ""

    # services - (Optional) (Optional, Type: list, Conflicts with `document`) List of services which can assume the RAM role. The format of each item in this list is `${service}.aliyuncs.com` or `${account_id}@${service}.aliyuncs.com`, such as `ecs.aliyuncs.com` and `1234567890000@ots.aliyuncs.com`. The `${service}` can be `ecs`, `log`, `apigateway` and so on, the `${account_id}` refers to someone's Alicloud account id.
    services = ""

    # ram_users - (Optional) (Optional, Type: list, Conflicts with `document`) List of ram users who can assume the RAM role. The format of each item in this list is `acs:ram::${account_id}:root` or `acs:ram::${account_id}:user/${user_name}`, such as `acs:ram::1234567890000:root` and `acs:ram::1234567890001:user/Mary`. The `${user_name}` is the name of a RAM user which must exists in the Alicloud account indicated by the `${account_id}`.
    ram_users = ""

    # version - (Optional) (Optional, Conflicts with `document`) Version of the RAM role policy document. Valid value is `1`. Default value is `1`.
    version = ""

    # document - (Optional) (Optional, Conflicts with `services`, `ram_users` and `version`) Authorization strategy of the RAM role. It is required when the `services` and `ram_users` are not specified.
    document = ""

    # description - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) Description of the RAM role. This name can have a string of 1 to 1024 characters.
    description = ""

    # force - (Optional) This parameter is used for resource destroy. Default value is `false`.
    force = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The role ID.
    # "name" - The role name.
    # "arn" - The role arn.
    # "description" - The role description.
    # "version" - The role policy document version.
    # "document" - Authorization strategy of the role.
    # "ram_users" - List of services which can assume the RAM role. 
    # "services" - List of services which can assume the RAM role.
}
alicloud-resource-ram-role.description: Provides a RAM Role resource. ~> **NOTE:** When you want to destroy this resource forcefully(means remove all the relationships associated with it automatically and then destroy it) without set `force`  with `true` at beginning, you need add `force = true` to configuration file and run `terraform plan`, then you can delete resource forcefully.

alicloud-resource-ram-role-attachment.body:
resource "alicloud_ram_role_attachment" "$1" {
    # role_name - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The name of role used to bind. This name can have a string of 1 to 64 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphens, such as "-", "_", and must not begin with a hyphen.
    role_name = ""

    # instance_ids - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The list of ECS instance's IDs.
    instance_ids = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "role_name" - The name of the role.
    # "instance_ids" The list of ECS instance's IDs.
}
alicloud-resource-ram-role-attachment.description: Provides a RAM role attachment resource to bind role for several ECS instances.

alicloud-resource-ram-role-policy-attach.body:
resource "alicloud_ram_role_policy_attachment" "$1" {
    # role_name - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) Name of the RAM Role. This name can have a string of 1 to 64 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphens, such as "-", "_", and must not begin with a hyphen.
    role_name = ""

    # policy_name - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) Name of the RAM policy. This name can have a string of 1 to 128 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphen "-", and must not begin with a hyphen.
    policy_name = ""

    # policy_type - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) Type of the RAM policy. It must be `Custom` or `System`.
    policy_type = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The attachment ID.
    # "role_name" - The role name.
    # "policy_name" - The policy name.
    # "policy_type" - The policy type.
}
alicloud-resource-ram-role-policy-attach.description: Provides a RAM Role attachment resource.

alicloud-resource-ram-user.body:
resource "alicloud_ram_user" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Name of the RAM user. This name can have a string of 1 to 64 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphens, such as "-",".","_", and must not begin with a hyphen.
    name = ""

    # display_name - (Optional) Name of the RAM user which for display. This name can have a string of 1 to 12 characters or Chinese characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or Chinese characters or hyphens, such as "-",".", and must not end with a hyphen.
    display_name = ""

    # mobile - (Optional) Phone number of the RAM user. This number must contain an international area code prefix, just look like this: 86-18600008888.
    mobile = ""

    # email - (Optional) Email of the RAM user.
    email = ""

    # comments - (Optional) Comment of the RAM user. This parameter can have a string of 1 to 128 characters.
    comments = ""

    # force - (Optional) This parameter is used for resource destroy. Default value is `false`.
    force = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The user ID.
    # "name" - The user name.
    # "display_name" - The user display name.
    # "mobile" - The user phone number.
    # "email" - The user email.
    # "comments" - The user comments.
}
alicloud-resource-ram-user.description: Provides a RAM User resource. ~> **NOTE:** When you want to destroy this resource forcefully(means release all the relationships associated with it automatically and then destroy it) without set `force`  with `true` at beginning, you need add `force = true` to configuration file and run `terraform plan`, then you can delete resource forcefully.

alicloud-resource-ram-user-policy-attach.body:
resource "alicloud_ram_user_policy_attachment" "$1" {
    # user_name - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) Name of the RAM user. This name can have a string of 1 to 64 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphens, such as "-",".","_", and must not begin with a hyphen.
    user_name = ""

    # policy_name - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) Name of the RAM policy. This name can have a string of 1 to 128 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphen "-", and must not begin with a hyphen.
    policy_name = ""

    # policy_type - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) Type of the RAM policy. It must be `Custom` or `System`.
    policy_type = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The attachment ID.
    # "user_name" - The user name.
    # "policy_name" - The policy name.
    # "policy_type" - The policy type.
}
alicloud-resource-ram-user-policy-attach.description: Provides a RAM User Policy attachment resource.

alicloud-resource-route-entry.body:
resource "alicloud_route_entry" "$1" {
    # router_id - (Optional) (Deprecated) This argument has beeb deprecated. Please use other arguments to launch a custom route entry.
    router_id = ""

    # route_table_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The ID of the route table.
    route_table_id = ""

    # destination_cidrblock - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The RouteEntry's target network segment.
    destination_cidrblock = ""

    # nexthop_type - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The next hop type. Available values: `Instance` (Default): Route the traffic destined for the destination CIDR block to an ECS instance in the VPC.
    nexthop_type = ""

    # nexthop_type - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The next hop type. Available values: `Instance` (Default): Route the traffic destined for the destination CIDR block to an ECS instance in the VPC.
    nexthop_type = ""

    # nexthop_type - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The next hop type. Available values: `Instance` (Default): Route the traffic destined for the destination CIDR block to an ECS instance in the VPC.
    nexthop_type = ""

    # nexthop_type - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The next hop type. Available values: `Instance` (Default): Route the traffic destined for the destination CIDR block to an ECS instance in the VPC.
    nexthop_type = ""

    # nexthop_type - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The next hop type. Available values: `Instance` (Default): Route the traffic destined for the destination CIDR block to an ECS instance in the VPC.
    nexthop_type = ""

    # nexthop_type - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The next hop type. Available values: `Instance` (Default): Route the traffic destined for the destination CIDR block to an ECS instance in the VPC.
    nexthop_type = ""

    # nexthop_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The route entry's next hop. ECS instance ID or VPC router interface ID.
    nexthop_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "router_id" - The ID of the virtual router attached to Vpc.
    # "nexthop_id" - (Required, Forces new resource) The route entry's next hop. ECS instance ID or VPC router interface ID.
    # "route_table_id" - The ID of the route table.
    # "nexthop_id" - (Required, Forces new resource) The route entry's next hop. ECS instance ID or VPC router interface ID.
    # "destination_cidrblock" - The RouteEntry's target network segment.
    # "nexthop_id" - (Required, Forces new resource) The route entry's next hop. ECS instance ID or VPC router interface ID.
    # "nexthop_type" - The next hop type.
    # "nexthop_id" - (Required, Forces new resource) The route entry's next hop. ECS instance ID or VPC router interface ID.
    # "nexthop_id" - The route entry's next hop.
    # "nexthop_id" - (Required, Forces new resource) The route entry's next hop. ECS instance ID or VPC router interface ID.
}
alicloud-resource-route-entry.description: Provides a route entry resource. A route entry represents a route item of one VPC route table.

alicloud-resource-route-table.body:
resource "alicloud_route_table" "$1" {
    # vpc_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The vpc_id of the route table, the field can't be changed.
    vpc_id = ""

    # name - (Optional) The name of the route table.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) The description of the route table instance.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the route table instance id.
}
alicloud-resource-route-table.description:
Provides a route table resource to add customized route tables. ~> **NOTE:** Terraform will auto build route table instance while it uses `alicloud_route_table` to build a route table resource. Currently, customized route tables are available in most regions apart from China (Beijing), China (Hangzhou), and China (Shenzhen) regions.
For information about route table and how to use it, see [What is Route Table](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/87057.htm).

alicloud-resource-route-table-attachment.body:
resource "alicloud_route_table_attachment" "$1" {
    # vswitch_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The vswitch_id of the route table attachment, the field can't be changed.
    vswitch_id = ""

    # route_table_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The route_table_id of the route table attachment, the field can't be changed.
    route_table_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the route table attachment id and formates as "<route_table_id>:<vswitch_id>".
}
alicloud-resource-route-table-attachment.description: Provides an Alicloud Route Table Attachment resource for associating Route Table to VSwitch Instance. ~> **NOTE:** Terraform will auto build route table attachment while it uses `alicloud_route_table_attachment` to build a route table attachment resource. For information about route table and how to use it, see [What is Route Table](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/87057.htm).

alicloud-resource-router-interface.body:
resource "alicloud_router_interface" "$1" {
    # opposite_region - (Optional) (Required, Force New) The Region of peer side.
    opposite_region = ""

    # router_type - (Optional) (Required, Forces New) Router Type. Optional value: VRouter, VBR. Accepting side router interface type only be VRouter.
    router_type = ""

    # opposite_router_type - (Optional) (Deprecated) It has been deprecated from version 1.11.0. resource alicloud_router_interface_connection's 'opposite_router_type' instead.
    opposite_router_type = ""

    # router_id - (Optional) (Required, Force New) The Router ID.
    router_id = ""

    # opposite_router_id - (Optional) (Deprecated) It has been deprecated from version 1.11.0. Use resource alicloud_router_interface_connection's 'opposite_router_id' instead.
    opposite_router_id = ""

    # role - (Optional) (Required, Force New) The role the router interface plays. Optional value: `InitiatingSide`, `AcceptingSide`.
    role = ""

    # specification - (Optional) Specification of router interfaces. It is valid when `role` is `InitiatingSide`. Accepting side's role is default to set as 'Negative'. For more about the specification, refer to [Router interface specification](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/36037.htm).
    specification = ""

    # access_point_id - (Optional) (Deprecated) It has been deprecated from version 1.11.0.
    access_point_id = ""

    # opposite_access_point_id - (Optional) (Deprecated) It has been deprecated from version 1.11.0.
    opposite_access_point_id = ""

    # opposite_interface_id - (Optional) (Deprecated) It has been deprecated from version 1.11.0. Use resource alicloud_router_interface_connection's 'opposite_router_id' instead.
    opposite_interface_id = ""

    # opposite_interface_owner_id - (Optional) (Deprecated) It has been deprecated from version 1.11.0. Use resource alicloud_router_interface_connection's 'opposite_interface_id' instead.
    opposite_interface_owner_id = ""

    # name - (Optional) Name of the router interface. Length must be 2-80 characters long. Only Chinese characters, English letters, numbers, period (.), underline (_), or dash (-) are permitted.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) Description of the router interface. It can be 2-256 characters long or left blank. It cannot start with http:// and https://.
    description = ""

    # health_check_source_ip - (Optional) Used as the Packet Source IP of health check for disaster recovery or ECMP. It is only valid when `router_type` is `VBR`. The IP must be an unused IP in the local VPC. It and `health_check_target_ip` must be specified at the same time.
    health_check_source_ip = ""

    # health_check_target_ip - (Optional) Used as the Packet Target IP of health check for disaster recovery or ECMP. It is only valid when `router_type` is `VBR`. The IP must be an unused IP in the local VPC. It and `health_check_source_ip` must be specified at the same time.
    health_check_target_ip = ""

    # instance_charge_type - (Optional) (Optional, ForceNew) The billing method of the router interface. Valid values are "PrePaid" and "PostPaid". Default to "PostPaid". Router Interface doesn't support "PrePaid" when region and opposite_region are the same.
    instance_charge_type = ""

    # period - (Optional) (Optional, ForceNew) The duration that you will buy the resource, in month. It is valid when `instance_charge_type` is `PrePaid`. Default to 1. Valid values: [1-9, 12, 24, 36]. At present, the provider does not support modify "period" and you can do that via web console.
    period = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - Router interface ID.
    # "router_id" - Router ID.
    # "router_type" - Router type.
    # "role" - Router interface role.
    # "name" - Router interface name.
    # "description" - Router interface description.
    # "specification" - Router nterface specification.
    # "access_point_id" - Access point of the router interface.
    # "opposite_access_point_id" - (Deprecated) It has been deprecated from version 1.11.0.
    # "opposite_router_type" - Peer router type.
    # "opposite_router_id" - Peer router ID.
    # "opposite_interface_id" - Peer router interface ID.
    # "opposite_interface_owner_id" - Peer account ID.
    # "health_check_source_ip" - Source IP of Packet of Line HealthCheck.
    # "health_check_target_ip" - Target IP of Packet of Line HealthCheck.
}
alicloud-resource-router-interface.description: Provides a VPC router interface resource aim to build a connection between two VPCs. -> **NOTE:** Only one pair of connected router interfaces can exist between two routers. Up to 5 router interfaces can be created for each router and each account. -> **NOTE:** The router interface is not connected when it is created. It can be connected by means of resource [alicloud_router_interface_connection](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/alicloud/r/router_interface_connection.html).

alicloud-resource-router-interface-conne.body:
resource "alicloud_router_interface_connection" "$1" {
    # interface_id - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) One side router interface ID.
    interface_id = ""

    # opposite_interface_id - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) Another side router interface ID. It must belong the specified "opposite_interface_owner_id" account.
    opposite_interface_id = ""

    # opposite_interface_owner_id - (Optional) (Optional, ForceNew) Another side router interface account ID. Log on to the Alibaba Cloud console, select User Info > Account Management to check the account ID. Default to [Provider account_id](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/alicloud/index.html#account_id).
    opposite_interface_owner_id = ""

    # opposite_router_id - (Optional) (Optional, ForceNew) Another side router ID. It must belong the specified "opposite_interface_owner_id" account. It is valid when field "opposite_interface_owner_id" is specified.
    opposite_router_id = ""

    # opposite_router_type - (Optional) (Optional, ForceNew) Another side router Type. Optional value: VRouter, VBR. It is valid when field "opposite_interface_owner_id" is specified.
    opposite_router_type = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - Router interface ID. The value is equal to "interface_id".
}
alicloud-resource-router-interface-conne.description:
Provides a VPC router interface connection resource to connect two router interfaces which are in two different VPCs.
After that, all of the two router interfaces will be active. -> **NOTE:** At present, Router interface does not support changing opposite router interface, the connection delete action is only deactivating it to inactive, not modifying the connection to empty. -> **NOTE:** If you want to changing opposite router interface, you can delete router interface and re-build them. -> **NOTE:** A integrated router interface connection tunnel requires both InitiatingSide and AcceptingSide configuring opposite router interface. -> **NOTE:** Please remember to add a `depends_on` clause in the router interface connection from the InitiatingSide to the AcceptingSide, because the connection from the AcceptingSide to the InitiatingSide must be done first.

alicloud-resource-security-group.body:
resource "alicloud_security_group" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) The name of the security group. Defaults to null.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) The security group description. Defaults to null.
    description = ""

    # vpc_id - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) The VPC ID.
    vpc_id = ""

    # inner_access - (Optional) Whether to allow both machines to access each other on all ports in the same security group.
    inner_access = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the security group
    # "vpc_id" - The VPC ID.
    # "name" - The name of the security group
    # "description" - The description of the security group
    # "inner_access" - Whether to allow inner network access.
    # "tags" - The instance tags, use jsonencode(item) to display the value.
}
alicloud-resource-security-group.description: Provides a security group resource. ~> **NOTE:** `alicloud_security_group` is used to build and manage a security group, and `alicloud_security_group_rule` can define ingress or egress rules for it. ~> **NOTE:** From version 1.7.2, `alicloud_security_group` has supported to segregate different ECS instance in which the same security group.

alicloud-resource-security-group-rule.body:
resource "alicloud_security_group_rule" "$1" {
    # security_group_id - (Required) The security group to apply this rule to.
    security_group_id = ""

    # port_range - (Required) The range of port numbers relevant to the IP protocol. Default to "-1/-1". When the protocol is tcp or udp, each side port number range from 1 to 65535 and '-1/-1' will be invalid.
    port_range = ""

    # ip_protocol - (Required) The protocol. Can be `tcp`, `udp`, `icmp`, `gre` or `all`.
    ip_protocol = ""

    # type - (Required) The type of rule being created. Valid options are `ingress` (inbound) or `egress` (outbound).
    type = ""

    # nic_type - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) Network type, can be either `internet` or `intranet`, the default value is `internet`.
    nic_type = ""

    # policy - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) Authorization policy, can be either `accept` or `drop`, the default value is `accept`.
    policy = ""

    # priority - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) Authorization policy priority, with parameter values: `1-100`, default value: 1.
    priority = ""

    # cidr_ip - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) The target IP address range. The default value is 0.0.0.0/0 (which means no restriction will be applied). Other supported formats include 10.159.6.18/12. Only IPv4 is supported.
    cidr_ip = ""

    # source_security_group_id - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) The target security group ID within the same region. If this field is specified, the `nic_type` can only select `intranet`.
    source_security_group_id = ""

    # source_group_owner_account - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) The Alibaba Cloud user account Id of the target security group when security groups are authorized across accounts.  This parameter is invalid if `cidr_ip` has already been set.
    source_group_owner_account = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the security group rule
    # "type" - The type of rule, "ingress" or "egress"
    # "name" - The name of the security group
    # "port_range" - The range of port numbers
    # "ip_protocol" - The protocol of the security group rule
}
alicloud-resource-security-group-rule.description:
Provides a security group rule resource.
Represents a single `ingress` or `egress` group rule, which can be added to external Security Groups. ~> **NOTE:**  `nic_type` should set to `intranet` when security group type is `vpc` or specifying the `source_security_group_id`. In this situation it does not distinguish between intranet and internet, the rule is effective on them both.

alicloud-resource-slb.body:
resource "alicloud_slb" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) The name of the SLB. This name must be unique within your AliCloud account, can have a maximum of 80 characters,
    name = ""

    # internet - (Optional) (Optional, Forces New Resource) If true, the SLB addressType will be internet, false will be intranet, Default is false. If load balancer launched in VPC, this value must be "false".
    internet = ""

    # internet_charge_type - (Optional) (Optional, Forces New Resource) Valid
    internet_charge_type = ""

    # bandwidth - (Optional) Valid
    bandwidth = ""

    # listener - (Optional) (Deprecated) The field has been deprecated from terraform-alicloud-provider [version 1.3.0](https://github.com/alibaba/terraform-provider/releases/tag/V1.3.0), and use resource `alicloud_slb_listener` to replace.
    listener = ""

    # vswitch_id - (Optional) (Required for a VPC SLB, Forces New Resource) The VSwitch ID to launch in.
    vswitch_id = ""

    # specification - (Optional) The specification of the Server Load Balancer instance. Default to empty string indicating it is "Shared-Performance" instance.
    specification = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource. The `tags` can have a maximum of 10 tag for every load balancer instance.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the load balancer.
    # "name" - The name of the load balancer.
    # "internet" - The internet of the load balancer.
    # "internet_charge_type" - The internet_charge_type of the load balancer.
    # "bandwidth" - The bandwidth of the load balancer.
    # "vswitch_id" - The VSwitch ID of the load balancer. Only available on SLB launched in a VPC.
    # "address" - The IP address of the load balancer.
    # "specification" - The specification of the Server Load Balancer instance.
}
alicloud-resource-slb.description:
Provides an Application Load Balancer resource. -> **NOTE:** Resource `alicloud_slb` has deprecated 'listener' filed from terraform-alicloud-provider [version 1.3.0](https://github.com/alibaba/terraform-provider/releases/tag/V1.3.0) . You can create new listeners for Load Balancer by resource `alicloud_slb_listener`.
If you have had several listeners in one load balancer, you can import them via the specified listener ID. In the `alicloud_slb_listener`, listener ID is consist of load balancer ID and frontend port, and its format is `<load balancer ID>:<frontend port>`, like "lb-hr2fwnf32t:8080". -> **NOTE:** At present, to avoid some unnecessary regulation confusion, SLB can not support alicloud international account to create "paybybandwidth" instance. -> **NOTE:** The supported specifications vary by region. Currently not all regions support guaranteed-performance instances.
For more details about guaranteed-performance instance, see [Guaranteed-performance instances](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/27657.htm).

alicloud-resource-slb-acl.body:
resource "alicloud_slb_acl" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Name of the access control list.
    name = ""

    # ip_version - (Optional) (Optional, ForceNew) The IP Version of access control list is the type of its entry (IP addresses or CIDR blocks). It values ipv4/ipv6. Our plugin provides a default ip_version: "ipv4".
    ip_version = ""

    # entry_list - (Optional) A list of entry (IP addresses or CIDR blocks) to be added. At most 50 etnry can be supported in one resource. It contains two sub-fields as `Entry Block` follows.
    entry_list = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The Id of the access control list.
}
alicloud-resource-slb-acl.description:
An access control list contains multiple IP addresses or CIDR blocks.
The access control list can help you to define multiple instance listening dimension,
and to meet the multiple usage for single access control list. Server Load Balancer allows you to configure access control for listeners.
You can configure different whitelists or blacklists for different listeners. You can configure access control
when you create a listener or change access control configuration after a listener is created. ~> **NOTE:** One access control list can be attached to many Listeners in different load balancer as whitelists or blacklists. ~> **NOTE:** The maximum number of access control lists per region  is 50. ~> **NOTE:** The maximum number of IP addresses added each time is 50. ~> **NOTE:** The maximum number of entries per access control list is 300. ~> **NOTE:** The maximum number of listeners that an access control list can be added to is 50. For information about slb and how to use it, see [What is Server Load Balancer](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/27539.htm). For information about acl and how to use it, see [Configure an access control list](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/85978.htm).

alicloud-resource-slb-attachment.body:
resource "alicloud_slb_attachment" "$1" {
    # instance_ids - (Required) A list of instance ids to added backend server in the SLB.
    instance_ids = ""

    # load_balancer_id - (Required) ID of the load balancer.
    load_balancer_id = ""

    # weight - (Optional) Weight of the instances. Valid value range: [0-100]. Default to 100.
    weight = ""

    # slb_id - (Optional) (Deprecated) It has been deprecated from provider version 1.6.0. New field 'load_balancer_id' replaces it.
    slb_id = ""

    # instances - (Optional) (Deprecated) It has been deprecated from provider version 1.6.0. New field 'instance_ids' replaces it.
    instances = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - ID of the resource.
    # "load_balancer_id" - ID of the load balancer.
    # "instance_ids" - A list of instance ids that have been added in the SLB.
    # "weight" - (Optional) Weight of the instances.
    # "backend_servers" - The backend servers of the load balancer.
}
alicloud-resource-slb-attachment.description: Add a group of backend servers (ECS instance) to the Server Load Balancer or remove them from it.

alicloud-resource-slb-ca-certificate.body:
resource "alicloud_slb_ca_certificate" "$1" {

alicloud-resource-slb-ca-certificate.description: A Load Balancer CA Certificate is used by the listener of the protocol https. For information about slb and how to use it, see [What is Server Load Balancer](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/27539.htm). alicloud-resource-slb-listener.body:
resource "alicloud_slb_listener" "$1" {
    # bandwidth - (Required) Bandwidth peak of Listener. For the public network instance charged per traffic consumed, the Bandwidth on Listener can be set to -1, indicating the bandwidth peak is unlimited. Valid values are [-1, 1-1000] in Mbps.
    bandwidth = ""

    # load_balancer_id - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The Load Balancer ID which is used to launch a new listener.
    load_balancer_id = ""

    # frontend_port - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) Port used by the Server Load Balancer instance frontend. Valid value range: [1-65535].
    frontend_port = ""

    # backend_port - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) Port used by the Server Load Balancer instance backend. Valid value range: [1-65535].
    backend_port = ""

    # protocol - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The protocol to listen on. Valid values are [`http`, `https`, `tcp`, `udp`].
    protocol = ""

    # scheduler - (Optional) (Optinal) Scheduling algorithm, Valid values are `wrr` and `wlc`.  Default to "wrr".
    scheduler = ""

    # sticky_session - (Optional) (Optinal) Whether to enable session persistence, Valid values are `on` and `off`. Default to `off`.
    sticky_session = ""

    # sticky_session_type - (Optional) (Optinal) Mode for handling the cookie. If `sticky_session` is "on", it is mandatory. Otherwise, it will be ignored. Valid values are `insert` and `server`. `insert` means it is inserted from Server Load Balancer; `server` means the Server Load Balancer learns from the backend server.
    sticky_session_type = ""

    # cookie_timeout - (Optional) (Optinal) Cookie timeout. It is mandatory when `sticky_session` is "on" and `sticky_session_type` is "insert". Otherwise, it will be ignored. Valid value range: [1-86400] in seconds.
    cookie_timeout = ""

    # cookie - (Optional) (Optinal) The cookie configured on the server. It is mandatory when `sticky_session` is "on" and `sticky_session_type` is "server". Otherwise, it will be ignored. Valid value：String in line with RFC 2965, with length being 1- 200. It only contains characters such as ASCII codes, English letters and digits instead of the comma, semicolon or spacing, and it cannot start with $.
    cookie = ""

    # persistence_timeout - (Optional) (Optinal) Timeout of connection persistence. Valid value range: [0-3600] in seconds. Default to 0 and means closing it.
    persistence_timeout = ""

    # health_check - (Optional) (Optinal) Whether to enable health check. Valid values are`on` and `off`. TCP and UDP listener's HealthCheck is always on, so it will be ignore when launching TCP or UDP listener.
    health_check = ""

    # health_check_type - (Optional) (Optinal) Type of health check. Valid values are: `tcp` and `http`. Default to `tcp` . TCP supports TCP and HTTP health check mode, you can select the particular mode depending on your application.
    health_check_type = ""

    # health_check_domain - (Optional) (Optinal) Domain name used for health check. When it used to launch TCP listener, `health_check_type` must be "http". Its length is limited to 1-80 and only characters such as letters, digits, ‘-‘ and ‘.’ are allowed. When it is not set or empty,  Server Load Balancer uses the private network IP address of each backend server as Domain used for health check.
    health_check_domain = ""

    # health_check_uri - (Optional) (Optinal) URI used for health check. When it used to launch TCP listener, `health_check_type` must be "http". Its length is limited to 1-80 and it must start with /. Only characters such as letters, digits, ‘-’, ‘/’, ‘.’, ‘%’, ‘?’, #’ and ‘&’ are allowed.
    health_check_uri = ""

    # health_check_connect_port - (Optional) (Optinal) Port used for health check. Valid value range: [1-65535]. Default to "None" means the backend server port is used.
    health_check_connect_port = ""

    # healthy_threshold - (Optional) (Optinal) Threshold determining the result of the health check is success. It is required when `health_check` is on. Valid value range: [1-10] in seconds. Default to 3.
    healthy_threshold = ""

    # unhealthy_threshold - (Optional) (Optinal) Threshold determining the result of the health check is fail. It is required when `health_check` is on. Valid value range: [1-10] in seconds. Default to 3.
    unhealthy_threshold = ""

    # health_check_timeout - (Optional) (Optinal) Maximum timeout of each health check response. It is required when `health_check` is on. Valid value range: [1-300] in seconds. Default to 5. Note: If `health_check_timeout` < `health_check_interval`, its will be replaced by `health_check_interval`.
    health_check_timeout = ""

    # health_check_interval - (Optional) (Optinal) Time interval of health checks. It is required when `health_check` is on. Valid value range: [1-50] in seconds. Default to 2.
    health_check_interval = ""

    # health_check_http_code - (Optional) (Optinal) Regular health check HTTP status code. Multiple codes are segmented by “,”. It is required when `health_check` is on. Default to `http_2xx`.  Valid values are: `http_2xx`,  `http_3xx`, `http_4xx` and `http_5xx`.
    health_check_http_code = ""

    # ssl_certificate_id - (Optional) (Optinal) Security certificate ID. It is required when `protocol` is `https`.
    ssl_certificate_id = ""

    # gzip - (Optional) (Optinal) Whether to enable "Gzip Compression". If enabled, files of specific file types will be compressed, otherwise, no files will be compressed. Default to true. Available in v1.13.0+.
    gzip = ""

    # x_forwarded_for - (Optional) (Optinal) Whether to set additional HTTP Header field "X-Forwarded-For" (documented below). Available in v1.13.0+.
    x_forwarded_for = ""

    # acl_status - (Optional) (Optinal) Whether to enable "acl(access control list)", the acl is specified by `acl_id`. Valid values are `on` and `off`. Default to `off`.
    acl_status = ""

    # acl_type - (Optional) (Optinal) Mode for handling the acl specified by acl_id. If `acl_status` is "on", it is mandatory. Otherwise, it will be ignored. Valid values are `white` and `black`. `white` means the Listener can only be accessed by client ip belongs to the acl; `black` means the Listener can not be accessed by client ip belongs to the acl.
    acl_type = ""

    # acl_id - (Optional) (Optinal) the id of access control list to be apply on the listener, is the id of resource alicloud_slb_acl. If `acl_status` is "on", it is mandatory. Otherwise, it will be ignored.
    acl_id = ""

    # established_timeout - (Optional) (Optinal) Timeout of tcp listener established connection idle timeout. Valid value range: [10-900] in seconds. Default to 900.
    established_timeout = ""

    # idle_timeout - (Optional) (Optinal) Timeout of http or https listener established connection idle timeout. Valid value range: [1-60] in seconds. Default to 15.
    idle_timeout = ""

    # request_timeout - (Optional) (Optinal) Timeout of http or https listener request (which does not get response from backend) timeout. Valid value range: [1-180] in seconds. Default to 60.
    request_timeout = ""

    # tls_cipher_policy - (Optional) (Optinal)  Https listener TLS cipher policy. Valid values are `tls_cipher_policy_1_0`, `tls_cipher_policy_1_1`, `tls_cipher_policy_1_2`, `tls_cipher_policy_1_2_strict`. Default to `tls_cipher_policy_1_0`. Currently the `tls_cipher_policy` can not be updated when load balancer instance is "Shared-Performance".
    tls_cipher_policy = ""

    # server_group_id - (Optional) (Optinal) the id of server group to be apply on the listener, is the id of resource `alicloud_slb_server_group`.
    server_group_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the load balancer listener. It is consist of "load_balancer_id" and "frontend_port": "<load_balancer_id>:<frontend_port>".
    # "load_balancer_id" - The Load Balancer ID which is used to launch a new listener.
    # "frontend_port" - Port used by the Server Load Balancer instance frontend.
    # "backend_port" - Port used by the Server Load Balancer instance backend.
    # "protocol" - The protocol to listen on.
    # "bandwidth" - Bandwidth peak of Listener.
    # "scheduler" - Scheduling algorithm.
    # "sticky_session" - Whether to enable session persistence.
    # "sticky_session_type" - Mode for handling the cookie.
    # "cookie_timeout" - Cookie timeout.
    # "cookie" - The cookie configured on the server.
    # "persistence_timeout" - Timeout of connection persistence.
    # "health_check" - Whether to enable health check.
    # "health_check_type" - Type of health check.
    # "health_check_domain" - Domain name used for health check.
    # "health_check_uri" - URI used for health check.
    # "health_check_connect_port" - Port used for health check.
    # "healthy_threshold" - Threshold determining the result of the health check is success.
    # "unhealthy_threshold" - Threshold determining the result of the health check is fail.
    # "health_check_timeout" - Maximum timeout of each health check response.
    # "health_check_interval" - Time interval of health checks.
    # "health_check_http_code" - Regular health check HTTP status code.
    # "ssl_certificate_id" - (Optinal) Security certificate ID.
}
alicloud-resource-slb-listener.description: Provides an Application Load Balancer Listener resource. For information about slb and how to use it, see [What is Server Load Balancer](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/27539.htm). For information about listener and how to use it, to see the following: [Configure a HTTP Listener](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/27592.htm).  [Configure a HTTPS Listener](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/27593.htm).  [Configure a TCP Listener](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/27594.htm).  [Configure a UDP Listener](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/27595.htm).

alicloud-resource-slb-rule.body:
resource "alicloud_slb_rule" "$1" {
    # server_group_id - (Required) ID of a virtual server group that will be forwarded.
    server_group_id = ""

    # load_balancer_id - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The Load Balancer ID which is used to launch the new forwarding rule.
    load_balancer_id = ""

    # name - (Optional) (Optional, ForceNew) Name of the forwarding rule. Our plugin provides a default name: "tf-slb-rule".
    name = ""

    # frontend_port - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The listener frontend port which is used to launch the new forwarding rule. Valid range: [1-65535].
    frontend_port = ""

    # domain - (Optional) (Optional, ForceNew) Domain name of the forwarding rule. It can contain letters a-z, numbers 0-9, hyphens (-), and periods (.),
    domain = ""

    # url - (Optional) (Optional, ForceNew) Domain of the forwarding rule. It must be 2-80 characters in length. Only letters a-z, numbers 0-9,
    url = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the forwarding rule.
    # "load_balancer_id" - The Load Balancer ID in which forwarding rule belongs.
    # "name" - The name of the forwarding rule.
    # "forntend_port" - The listener port in which forwarding rule belongs.
    # "domain" - The domain name of the forwarding rule.
    # "url" - The url of the forwarding rule.
    # "server_group_id" - The Id of the virtual server group.
}
alicloud-resource-slb-rule.description:
A forwarding rule is configured in `HTTP`/`HTTPS` listener and it used to listen a list of backend servers which in one specified virtual backend server group.
You can add forwarding rules to a listener to forward requests based on the domain names or the URL in the request. ~> **NOTE:** One virtual backend server group can be attached in multiple forwarding rules. ~> **NOTE:** At least one "Domain" or "Url" must be specified when creating a new rule. ~> **NOTE:** Having the same 'Domain' and 'Url' rule can not be created repeatedly in the one listener. ~> **NOTE:** Rule only be created in the `HTTP` or `HTTPS` listener. ~> **NOTE:** Only rule's virtual server group can be modified.

alicloud-resource-slb-server-certificate.body:
resource "alicloud_slb_server_certificate" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) Name of the Server Certificate.
    name = ""

    # server_certificate - (Optional) (Optional, ForceNew) the content of the ssl certificate. where `alicloud_certificate_id` is null, it is required, otherwise it is ignored.
    server_certificate = ""

    # private_key - (Optional) (Optional, ForceNew) the content of privat key of the ssl certificate specified by `server_certificate`. where `alicloud_certificate_id` is null, it is required, otherwise it is ignored.
    private_key = ""

    # alicloud_certificate_id - (Optional) an id of server certificate ssued/proxied by alibaba cloud. but it is not supported on the international site of alibaba cloud now.
    alicloud_certificate_id = ""

    # alicloud_certificate_name - (Optional) the name of the certificate specified by `alicloud_certificate_id`.but it is not supported on the international site of alibaba cloud now.
    alicloud_certificate_name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The Id of Server Certificate (SSL Certificate).
}
alicloud-resource-slb-server-certificate.description: A Load Balancer Server Certificate is an ssl Certificate used by the listener of the protocol https. For information about slb and how to use it, see [What is Server Load Balancer](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/27539.htm). For information about Server Certificate and how to use it, see [Configure Server Certificate](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/85968.htm).

alicloud-resource-slb-server-group.body:
resource "alicloud_slb_server_group" "$1" {
    # servers - (Required) A list of ECS instances to be added. At most 20 ECS instances can be supported in one resource. It contains three sub-fields as `Block server` follows.
    servers = ""

    # load_balancer_id - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The Load Balancer ID which is used to launch a new virtual server group.
    load_balancer_id = ""

    # name - (Optional) Name of the virtual server group. Our plugin provides a default name: "tf-server-group".
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the virtual server group.
    # "load_balancer_id" - The Load Balancer ID which is used to launch a new virtual server group.
    # "name" - The name of the virtual server group.
    # "servers" - A list of ECS instances that have be added.
}
alicloud-resource-slb-server-group.description:
A virtual server group contains several ECS instances. The virtual server group can help you to define multiple listening dimension,
and to meet the personalized requirements of domain name and URL forwarding. ~> **NOTE:** One ECS instance can be added into multiple virtual server groups. ~> **NOTE:** One virtual server group can be attached with multiple listeners in one load balancer. ~> **NOTE:** One Classic and Internet load balancer, its virtual server group can add Classic and VPC ECS instances. ~> **NOTE:** One Classic and Intranet load balancer, its virtual server group can only add Classic ECS instances. ~> **NOTE:** One VPC load balancer, its virtual server group can only add the same VPC ECS instances.

alicloud-resource-ssl-vpn-client-cert.body:
resource "alicloud_ssl_vpn_client_cert" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) The name of the client certificate.
    name = ""

    # ssl_vpn_server_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The ID of the SSL-VPN server.
    ssl_vpn_server_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the SSL-VPN client certificate.
    # "status" - The status of the client certificate.
}
alicloud-resource-ssl-vpn-client-cert.description:
Provides a SSL VPN client cert resource. ~> **NOTE:** Terraform will auto build SSL VPN client certs  while it uses `alicloud_ssl_vpn_client_cert` to build a ssl vpn client certs resource.
             It depends on VPN instance and SSL VPN Server.

alicloud-resource-ssl-vpn-server.body:
resource "alicloud_ssl_vpn_server" "$1" {
    # local_subnet - (Required) The CIDR block to be accessed by the client through the SSL-VPN connection.
    local_subnet = ""

    # client_ip_pool - (Required) The CIDR block from which access addresses are allocated to the virtual network interface card of the client.
    client_ip_pool = ""

    # name - (Optional) The name of the SSL-VPN server.
    name = ""

    # vpn_gateway_id - (Optional) (Required, ForceNew) The ID of the VPN gateway.
    vpn_gateway_id = ""

    # protocol - (Optional) The protocol used by the SSL-VPN server. Valid value: UDP(default) |TCP
    protocol = ""

    # cipher - (Optional) The encryption algorithm used by the SSL-VPN server. Valid value: AES-128-CBC (default)| AES-192-CBC | AES-256-CBC | none
    cipher = ""

    # port - (Optional) The port used by the SSL-VPN server. The default value is 1194.The following ports cannot be used: [22, 2222, 22222, 9000, 9001, 9002, 7505, 80, 443, 53, 68, 123, 4510, 4560, 500, 4500].
    port = ""

    # compress - (Optional) Specify whether to compress the communication. Valid value: true (default) | false
    compress = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the SSL-VPN server.
    # "internet_ip" - The internet IP of the SSL-VPN server.
    # "connections" - The number of current connections.
    # "max_connections" - The maximum number of connections.
}
alicloud-resource-ssl-vpn-server.description: Provides a SSL VPN server resource. [Refer to details](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/64960.htm) ~> **NOTE:** Terraform will auto build ssl vpn server while it uses `alicloud_ssl_vpn_server` to build a ssl vpn server resource.

alicloud-resource-vpc.body:
resource "alicloud_snat_entry" "$1" {
    # snat_ip - (Required) The SNAT ip address, the ip must along bandwidth package public ip which `alicloud_nat_gateway` argument `bandwidth_packages`.
    snat_ip = ""

    # snat_table_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The value can get from `alicloud_nat_gateway` Attributes "snat_table_ids".
    snat_table_id = ""

    # source_vswitch_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The vswitch ID.
    source_vswitch_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}

alicloud-resource-vpn-connection.body:
resource "alicloud_vpn_connection" "$1" {
    # customer_gateway_id - (Required) The ID of the customer gateway.
    customer_gateway_id = ""

    # name - (Optional) The name of the IPsec connection.
    name = ""

    # vpn_gateway_id - (Optional) (Required ForceNew) The ID of the VPN gateway.
    vpn_gateway_id = ""

    # local_subnet - (Optional) (Required, Type:Set) The CIDR block of the VPC to be connected with the local data center. This parameter is used for phase-two negotiation.
    local_subnet = ""

    # remote_subnet - (Optional) (Required, Type:Set) The CIDR block of the local data center. This parameter is used for phase-two negotiation.
    remote_subnet = ""

    # effect_immediately - (Optional) Whether to delete a successfully negotiated IPsec tunnel and initiate a negotiation again. Valid value:true,false.
    effect_immediately = ""

    # ike_config - (Optional) The configurations of phase-one negotiation.
    ike_config = ""

    # ipsec_config - (Optional) The configurations of phase-two negotiation.
    ipsec_config = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the VPN connection id.
    # "status" - The status of VPN connection.
}
alicloud-resource-vpn-connection.description:
Provides a VPN connection resource. ~> **NOTE:** Terraform will auto build vpn connection while it uses `alicloud_vpn_connection` to build a vpn connection resource.
             The vpn connection depends on VPN and VPN customer gateway.

alicloud-resource-vpn-customer-gateway.body:
resource "alicloud_vpn_customer_gateway" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) The name of the VPN customer gateway. Defaults to null.
    name = ""

    # ip_address - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The IP address of the customer gateway.
    ip_address = ""

    # description - (Optional) The description of the VPN customer gateway instance.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the VPN customer gateway instance id.
}
alicloud-resource-vpn-customer-gateway.description: Provides a VPN customer gateway resource. ~> **NOTE:** Terraform will auto build vpn customer gateway instance  while it uses `alicloud_vpn_customer_gateway` to build a vpn customer gateway resource.

alicloud-resource-vpn-gateway.body:
resource "alicloud_vpn_gateway" "$1" {
    # bandwidth - (Required) The value should be 10, 100, 200, 500, 1000 if the user is postpaid, otherwise it can be 5, 10, 20, 50, 100, 200, 500, 1000.
    bandwidth = ""

    # name - (Optional) The name of the VPN. Defaults to null.
    name = ""

    # vpc_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The VPN belongs the vpc_id, the field can't be changed.
    vpc_id = ""

    # instance_charge_type - (Optional) The charge type for instance. Valid value: PostPaid, PrePaid. Default to PostPaid.
    instance_charge_type = ""

    # period - (Optional) The filed is only required while the InstanceChargeType is prepaid.
    period = ""

    # enable_ipsec - (Optional) Enable or Disable IPSec VPN. At least one type of VPN should be enabled.
    enable_ipsec = ""

    # enable_ssl - (Optional) Enable or Disable SSL VPN.  At least one type of VPN should be enabled.
    enable_ssl = ""

    # ssl_connections - (Optional) The max connections of SSL VPN. Default to 5.
    ssl_connections = ""

    # description - (Optional) The description of the VPN instance.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the VPN instance id.
    # "internet_ip" - The internet ip of the VPN.
    # "status" - The status of the VPN gateway.
    # "business_status" - The business status of the VPN gateway.
}
alicloud-resource-vpn-gateway.description: Provides a VPN gateway resource. -> **NOTE:** Terraform will auto build vpn instance  while it uses `alicloud_vpn_gateway` to build a vpn resource. -> Currently International-Site account can open `PostPaid` VPN gateway and China-Site account can open `PrePaid` VPN gateway.

alicloud-resource-vswitch.body:
resource "alicloud_vswitch" "$1" {
    # availability_zone - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The AZ for the switch.
    availability_zone = ""

    # vpc_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The VPC ID.
    vpc_id = ""

    # cidr_block - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The CIDR block for the switch.
    cidr_block = ""

    # name - (Optional) The name of the switch. Defaults to null.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) The switch description. Defaults to null.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the switch.
    # "availability_zone" The AZ for the switch.
    # "cidr_block" - The CIDR block for the switch.
    # "vpc_id" - The VPC ID.
    # "name" - The name of the switch.
    # "description" - The description of the switch.
}
